descriptionParts: The fileSettings, file name and directory, to use with an adapter for push and pull

properties.name: FileName
properties.description: The name of the file, including the file extension

properties.name: Directory
properties.description: The folder directory on your computer where the file is to be located. Directory should not include the name of the file.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: General settings for any Adapter, to be specified when instantiating the Adapter.Implement this class to make your own Toolkit settings, e.g. SpeckleAdapterSettings.

properties.name: WrapNonBHoMObjects
properties.description: If your Toolkit needs support for non-BHoM objects, set this to true.

properties.name: CloneBeforePush
properties.description: Deep clones the objects before Pushing them.As the objects get modified during the Push (e.g. their externalId is added to them),this avoids backpropagation in visual programming environments like Grasshopper.

properties.name: HandleDependencies
properties.description: If your adapter does not define DependencyTypes, this can be set to false for performance.

properties.name: CreateOnly_DistinctObjects
properties.description: If true, CreateOnly method calls Distinct() on the first-level objects.

properties.name: CreateOnly_DistinctDependencies
properties.description: If true, CreateOnly method calls Distinct() on the dependency objects.

descriptionParts: Enum values:
-AdapterDefault: If this is chosen, then the m_AdapterSettings.DefaultPullType is picked.
Controls which type of export should be done by the Adapter `Push` action.
Enum values:
-FullPush: Calls all CRUD methods as appropriate.
-CreateOnly: Uses only the Create CRUD method to export the objects. This may create duplicates if the object already exists.
-CreateNonExisting: Same as FullPush, but does not update pre-existing objects.
-UpdateOnly: Uses only the Update CRUD method to update the objects in the external software. All other objects in the model are left untouched.
-UpdateOrCreateOnly: Attempt to Update the objects if possible, otherwise Create them. Deletion is not included in this type.
-DeleteThenCreate: For all objects being Pushed, identifies their type, calls Delete to remove all of those types, then it Creates them.
-AdapterDefault: AdapterDefault - Picks the value hard-coded in the specific Adapter.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: Configurations specific for an Adapter Action (Push, Pull, etc).
Consider that your tookit might have a more specific implementation available. Try to look for [your toolkit name]ActionConfig.

properties.name: WrapNonBHoMObjects
properties.description: If true, the Push action wraps any non-BHoM type into a BH.oM.Adapter.ObjectWrapper, allowing them to make use of the full Adapter workflow.

properties.name: AllowHashForComparing
properties.description: If true and if no specific EqualityComparer is found for the type, Diffing hashes are computed and used to compare the objects.

properties.name: DiffingConfig
properties.description: Configurations for the Diffing hashing. Requires `AllowHashForComparing` to be set to true.  This is a BH.oM.Diffing.DiffingConfig:  General configurations for the Diffing process, including settings for the Hash computation.

descriptionParts: Used to instruct the adapter to exit the software. The adapter will generally not be useable after running this command as the link to the software will be broken.

properties.name: SaveBeforeClose
properties.description: If set to true, the adapter attempts to save any open file, closes the file and exits the software.

descriptionParts: Used to instruct the external software to run a certain command.

Settings to determine the uniqueness of an Object.

properties.name: PropertyExceptions
properties.description: Names of properties you want to disregard in defining the uniqueness of an object. `BHoM_Guid` is always added by default. Supports * wildcard (see examples below). Examples of valid values: `BHoM_Guid`, `StartNode`, `Bar.StartNode.Point.X`, `Bar.*.Point.Y`

properties.name: NamespaceExceptions
properties.description: Any corresponding namespace is ignored. E.g. `BH.oM.Structure`.

properties.name: TypeExceptions
properties.description: Any corresponding type is ignored. E.g. `typeof(Guid)`.

properties.name: CustomdataKeysExceptions
properties.description: Keys of the BHoMObjects' CustomData dictionary that should be ignored. By default it includes `RenderMesh`.

properties.name: PropertiesToConsider
properties.description: If any name is specified here, only properties corresponding to that name will be considered in the hash. This has higher priority than `PropertyExceptions`. Works only for top-level properties (not subclass properties).

properties.name: MaxNesting
properties.description: If any property is nested into the object over that level, it is ignored. Defaults to 100.

properties.name: NumericTolerance
properties.description: Numeric tolerance for property values, applied to all numerical properties. Applies rounding for numbers smaller than this. Defaults to 1E-12.

properties.name: FractionalDigitsPerProperty
properties.description: Number of fractional digits retained for individual property. If a property name matches a key in the dictionary, applies a rounding to the corresponding number of digits. Supports * wildcard in the property name matching. E.g. `{ { StartNode.Point.*, 2 } }`.

descriptionParts: A plane curve. A circular Arc, a curve, with a constant distance from a point, its centre, defined it the local angular domain between start and end angle.

properties.name: CoordinateSystem
properties.description: Defines Arc centre equal to Origin of the CoordinateSystem, as well as the orientation of the Arc in three-dimensional space, equal to local xy-Plane of the CoordinateSystem.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.CoordinateSystem.Cartesian:  A three-dimensional Cartesian coordinate system, as defined by a set of mutually orthogonal unit vectors and a common origin point

properties.name: Radius
properties.description: Distance from the CoordinateSystem.Origin to the any point on Arc.

properties.name: StartAngle
properties.description: Angle in radians to the start point from the local x-axis, counter clockwise around the local z-axis.

properties.name: EndAngle
properties.description: Angle in radians to the end point from the local x-axis, counter clockwise around the local z-axis.

descriptionParts: A plane curve. Standard circle defining a curve of constant distance from a point, its Centre.

properties.name: Centre
properties.description: Origin point defining location of the Circle in three-dimensional space.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Point:  Defines a dimensionless location in three-dimensional space.

properties.name: Normal
properties.description: Vector perpendicular to the plane in which the Circle lies.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Vector:  Defines a direction and magnitude in three-dimensional Euclidean space.

properties.name: Radius
properties.description: Distance from the Centre to any point on Circle.

descriptionParts: A plane curve. A standard ellipse defining a curve of constant combined distance around two foci.
The larger of the two radii defines the major axis of the Ellipse, and the line along which the two foci lie.

properties.name: Centre
properties.description: Origin point defining location of the Ellipse in three-dimensional space.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Point:  Defines a dimensionless location in three-dimensional space.

properties.name: Axis1
properties.description: Together with Axis2 defines orientation in three-dimensional space. Direction only, and not magnitude, matters.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Vector:  Defines a direction and magnitude in three-dimensional Euclidean space.

properties.name: Axis2
properties.description: Together with Axis1 defines orientation in three-dimensional space. Direction only, and not magnitude, matters.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Vector:  Defines a direction and magnitude in three-dimensional Euclidean space.

properties.name: Radius1
properties.description: Distance from the Centre to a point on the Ellipse along Axis1.

properties.name: Radius2
properties.description: Distance from the Centre to a point on the Ellipse along Axis2.

descriptionParts: A straight segment in space defining the shortest distance between two points in three-dimensional Euclidean geometry.
The Vector from Start to End defines the Line direction, which can be important for some applications.

properties.name: Start
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Point:  Defines a dimensionless location in three-dimensional space.

properties.name: End
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Point:  Defines a dimensionless location in three-dimensional space.

properties.name: Infinite
properties.description: Defines the Line as a ray of infinite extents in both directions

descriptionParts: A non-uniform rational basis spline (or B-spline). Enables definition of smooth and continuous curves as piece-wise polynomial basis functions evaluated from discrete geometrical ControlPoints.
A NurbsCurve, through its use of ControlPoint Weightings, has the ability to precisely represent the conic sections, such as the circle and parabolas etc.

properties.name: ControlPoints
properties.description: An ordered set of three-dimensional points defining the curve shape. The control point locations are approximating, as opposed to interpolating, meaning in the general case the resulting curve will not pass through the control point locations themselves. The special case of where both Knot and ControlPoint count are equal defines a NurbsCurve of Degree 1. This shape will pass through all ControlPoints, linearly interpolating beween them and being equivalent to a Polyline.

properties.name: Weights
properties.description: A list of scalar factors, one for each ControlPoint. The weights in effect add an additional degree of freedom, allowing control over the relative influence of each control point on the curve shape

properties.name: Knots
properties.description: The knot vector is a non-decreasing list of numbers, the relative spacing of which define the spans and transition points of the basis functions along the curve's domain. Knot vector length must be equal to or greater than the number of ControlPoints, such that together, the difference in counts defines the order (and degree) of the NurbsCurve. The NurbsCurve degree is equal to order plus one.

descriptionParts: A composite curve constructed by combining a collection of curves of any type. Whole PolyCurve integrity, continuity and closure is not guaranteed at creation. Discontinuous and/or multi-region definitions are possible, although not recommended as may cause unexpected results in method operating on PolyCurves.

properties.name: Curves
properties.description: A collection of curves, of any or mixed type, which together define the composite shape.

descriptionParts: A curve consisting of a continuous chain of straight line segments. The Polyline is considered closed if the first and last ControlPoints are coincident

properties.name: ControlPoints
properties.description: An ordered set of three-dimensional points defining the curve shape

descriptionParts: Describes a discrete finite slice of an area. Used for numerical approximation of an integration.
A triangular or quadrilateral shape forming the basis of a polygon Mesh. Defined by corner vertices referencing indices of a Point list. See BH.oM.Geometry.Mesh object for usage.
A value of -1 for the fourth vertex D indicates the Face is triangular.

properties.name: A
properties.description: Index of first corner in Point list.

properties.name: B
properties.description: Index of second corner in Point list.

properties.name: C
properties.description: Index of third corner in Point list.

properties.name: D
properties.description: Index of fourth corner in Point list. Set to -1 for three-sided Face.

descriptionParts: Details the index of the cells which is behind and infront of each Face.

properties.name: FromCell
properties.description: Index of the cell the Face is connected to which its normal is pointing away from.

properties.name: ToCell
properties.description: Index of the cell the Face is connected to which its normal is pointing towards.

descriptionParts: A polygon mesh, defined by a list of triangular or quadrilateral Faces, Cells and their Vertices.

properties.name: Vertices
properties.description: Defines the three-dimensional Mesh geometry as  X, Y, Z coordinates.

properties.name: Faces
properties.description: The list of polygons, defined as corner Point indices referencing the list of Vertices.

properties.name: CellRelation
properties.description: A parallel list to the Faces, details the index of the cells which is behind and infront of each Face.

descriptionParts: A polygon mesh, defined by a list of triangular or quadrilateral Faces and their Vertices.

properties.name: Vertices
properties.description: Defines the three-dimensional Mesh geometry as  X, Y, Z coordinates.

properties.name: Faces
properties.description: The list of polygons, defined as corner Point indices referencing the list of Vertices.

descriptionParts: An axis aligned cuboid, which describes the smallest volume Box, oriented with the global coordinate system, that fully encompases a set of geometry.
Defined by its two extreme corner Points, these six coordinate values of Min and Max X, Y and Z are combined to specify all eight Box corners.

properties.name: Min
properties.description: The lower bound values for the X, Y and Z coordinates of the Box corner Points.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Point:  Defines a dimensionless location in three-dimensional space.

properties.name: Max
properties.description: The upper bound values for the X, Y and Z coordinates of the Box corner Points.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Point:  Defines a dimensionless location in three-dimensional space.

descriptionParts: A collection of multiple sets of Geometry of any or mixed type. Integrity, continuity and closure is not guaranteed. Discontinuous and/or mixed type definitions are possible, with no restrictions placed on how geometry can be combined.

properties.name: Elements
properties.description: A list of assorted geometry, which together define the composite shape.

descriptionParts: A four-dimensional vector, useful in calculation of affine transformations in three-dimensional space. See also BH.oM.Geometry.TransformMatrix.
A pair of curves representing the boundary of a trimmed surface in both global X, Y, Z coordinates (Curve3d) as well as local surface U, V parameter space (Curve2d).
A Surface Trim is immutable to ensure compatiblity of both curves.

properties.name: Curve3d
properties.description: Trim Curve in global X, Y, Z coordinates.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.ICurve:  The interface for all one-dimensional geometrical objects.  This can be of the following types: Arc, Circle, Ellipse, Line, NurbsCurve, PolyCurve, Polyline

properties.name: Curve2d
properties.description: Trim Curve in local surface U, V coordinates.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.ICurve:  The interface for all one-dimensional geometrical objects.  This can be of the following types: Arc, Circle, Ellipse, Line, NurbsCurve, PolyCurve, Polyline

descriptionParts: A 4x4 matrix describing linear tranformations in three-dimensional space, such as translations, rotations, reflections, scaling and shearing.
Solid representation defined by a collection of connected surfaces forming a closed volume

properties.name: Surfaces
properties.description: List of ISurfaces must form a closed volume - checks and guarantees to be performed at conversion

properties.name: Volume
properties.description: The enclosed volume created by the boundary surfaces. Property is set where available at conversion. If unavailable, or invalidated, will read NaN (not a number)

descriptionParts: A solid circular right angled cone

properties.name: Centre
properties.description: Point defining the centre of the circular base  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Point:  Defines a dimensionless location in three-dimensional space.

properties.name: Axis
properties.description: Vector perperdicular to the Cone base. Defines the orientation in three-dimensional space  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Vector:  Defines a direction and magnitude in three-dimensional Euclidean space.

properties.name: Radius
properties.description: Distance from the Centre to the edge of the circular base

properties.name: Height
properties.description: Distance from the centre of the base to the Cone's apex

descriptionParts: A polyhedron. Standard cuboid consisting of six right-angled quadrilateral faces.

properties.name: CoordinateSystem
properties.description: Defines both the Cuboid centre as the CoordinateSystem Origin, as well as the orientation in three-dimensional space.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.CoordinateSystem.Cartesian:  A three-dimensional Cartesian coordinate system, as defined by a set of mutually orthogonal unit vectors and a common origin point

properties.name: Length
properties.description: Dimension in the local x-axis. The Cuboid will have one face at a distance of Length/2 from the centre along the positive local x-axis and, one face at a distance of Length/2 from the centre along the negative local x-axis.

properties.name: Depth
properties.description: Dimension in the local y-axis. The Cuboid will have one face at a distance of Depth/2 from the centre along the positive local y-axis and, one face at a distance of Depth/2 from the centre along the negative local y-axis.

properties.name: Height
properties.description: Dimension in the local z-axis. The Cuboid will have one face at a distance of Height/2 from the centre along the positive local z-axis and, one face at a distance of Height/2 from the centre along the negative local z-axis.

descriptionParts: A solid circular right angled cylinder.

properties.name: Centre
properties.description: Point defining the centre of the circular base.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Point:  Defines a dimensionless location in three-dimensional space.

properties.name: Axis
properties.description: Vector perperdicular to the base. Defines the orientation in three-dimensional space.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Vector:  Defines a direction and magnitude in three-dimensional Euclidean space.

properties.name: Radius
properties.description: Distance from the Axis to the Cylinder boundary surface.

properties.name: Height
properties.description: Distance between the base and top surface, measured along the Axis.

descriptionParts: Standard sphere defining the closed bounding surface of constant distance from a point, its Centre

properties.name: Centre
properties.description: Origin point defining location of the Sphere in three-dimensional space  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Point:  Defines a dimensionless location in three-dimensional space.

properties.name: Radius
properties.description: Distance from the Centre to the Sphere boundary surface

descriptionParts: A standard solid circular ring torus, formed as a surface of revolution of a circle about an axis.

properties.name: Centre
properties.description: Origin point defining location of the Torus in three-dimensional space.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Point:  Defines a dimensionless location in three-dimensional space.

properties.name: Axis
properties.description: Vector defining the axis of revolution and the orientation of the Torus in three-dimensional space.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Vector:  Defines a direction and magnitude in three-dimensional Euclidean space.

properties.name: RadiusMajor
properties.description: Distance from the Torus Centre (and the axis of revolution) to the centre of the circular cross section.

properties.name: RadiusMinor
properties.description: The radius defining the size of the circular cross section.

descriptionParts: A constant cross section surface, defined by a single profile curve and a linear axis.

properties.name: Curve
properties.description: The Extrusion profile curve defining the constant cross sectional shape. Idential curves can be recreated at any point along the Extrusion axis through intersection with the Surface.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.ICurve:  The interface for all one-dimensional geometrical objects.  This can be of the following types: Arc, Circle, Ellipse, Line, NurbsCurve, PolyCurve, Polyline

properties.name: Direction
properties.description: The axis along which to translate the profile curve. The Vector magnitude determining the Extrusion length.  This is a Length [m] (as a BH.oM.Geometry.Vector)

properties.name: Capped
properties.description: Defines the Extrusion as closed and therfore a solid volume.

descriptionParts: A free-form surface defined by a series of cross sectional Curves. The surface provides a continuous interpolation passing through each Curve in order.

properties.name: Curves
properties.description: An ordered list of Curves defining the varying cross sectional surface profile.

descriptionParts: A free-form surface constructed as a UV grid of weighted NURBS ControlPoints. A continuous form is generated by approximating a two-directional network of piece-wise polynomial splines across the U and V directions, creating a smooth surface patch.
Supports Inner and Outer Trim Curves which enable greater flexibility in final shape through allowing free-form boundaries to be cut across the underlying UV surface domain.
A NurbsSurface is immutable as its defining properties are not mutually perpendicular to facilitate robust conversion between platforms.
See also BH.oM.Geometry.NurbsCurve for more info on non-uniform rational basis spline (or B-spline) weightings and other parameters.

properties.name: ControlPoints
properties.description: An ordered list of three-dimensional points defining the overall surface patch geometry. Each row of Points in the UV grid are listed sequentially as a single vector. The control point locations are approximating, as opposed to interpolating, meaning in the general case the resulting surface will not pass through the control point locations themselves.

properties.name: Weights
properties.description: A list of scalar factors, one for each ControlPoint. The weights in effect add an additional degree of freedom, allowing control over the relative influence of each control point on the surface shape.

properties.name: UKnots
properties.description: Defines the spans and transition points of the basis functions in the U domain. See also BH.oM.Geometry.NurbsCurve for more info on Knot Vectors.

properties.name: VKnots
properties.description: Defines the spans and transition points of the basis functions in the V domain. See also BH.oM.Geometry.NurbsCurve for more info on Knot Vectors.

properties.name: UDegree
properties.description: Sets the degree of the polynomial basis functions in the U direction of the surface patch. This ultimately defines the number of local U ControlPoints that influence a given point of the surface.

properties.name: VDegree
properties.description: Sets the degree of the polynomial basis functions in the V direction of the surface patch. This ultimately defines the number of local V ControlPoints that influence a given point of the surface.

properties.name: InnerTrims
properties.description: Allows definition of a set of free-form shapes to be cut from the underlying Surface.

properties.name: OuterTrims
properties.description: Allows definition of free-form external perimeter to the NurbsSurface patch.

descriptionParts: A constant circular cross section surface, following a defined curve path.

properties.name: Centreline
properties.description: Defines the central axis perpendicular to the circular cross sections, and thus the path along which the tubular surface follows.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.ICurve:  The interface for all one-dimensional geometrical objects.  This can be of the following types: Arc, Circle, Ellipse, Line, NurbsCurve, PolyCurve, Polyline

properties.name: Radius
properties.description: The distance from the Curve Centreline to a point on the Pipe surface.

properties.name: Capped
properties.description: Defines the Pipe as closed and therfore a solid volume.

descriptionParts: A surface defined by boundary edge curves lying in a common plane. Planarity toleraces default to the BH.oM.Geometry.Tolerace.Distance.

properties.name: ExternalBoundary
properties.description: Closed planar curve defining the outer boundary of the surface.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.ICurve:  The interface for all one-dimensional geometrical objects.  This can be of the following types: Arc, Circle, Ellipse, Line, NurbsCurve, PolyCurve, Polyline

properties.name: InternalBoundaries
properties.description: List of closed (co)planar curves defining any internal openings in the surface.

descriptionParts: A composite surface constructed by combining a collection of surfaces of any type. Whole PolySurface integrity, continuity and closure is not guaranteed at creation. Discontinuous and/or multi-region definitions are possible, although validity of some engine methods may vary depending on the PolySurface form.

properties.name: Surfaces
properties.description: A collection of surfaces, of any or mixed type, which together define the composite shape.

descriptionParts: An ordered set of mutually orthogonal unit vectors defining three-dimensional orientation in space

properties.name: X
properties.description: Unit vector defining local x coordinate axis  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Vector:  Defines a direction and magnitude in three-dimensional Euclidean space.

properties.name: Y
properties.description: Unit vector defining local y coordinate axis  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Vector:  Defines a direction and magnitude in three-dimensional Euclidean space.

properties.name: Z
properties.description: Unit vector defining local z coordinate axis  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Vector:  Defines a direction and magnitude in three-dimensional Euclidean space.

descriptionParts: Defines a flat infinite two-dimensional surface

properties.name: Origin
properties.description: A point through which the plane passes  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Point:  Defines a dimensionless location in three-dimensional space.

properties.name: Normal
properties.description: Vector perpendicualar to the plane, defining the orientation in three-dimensional space  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Vector:  Defines a direction and magnitude in three-dimensional Euclidean space.

descriptionParts: Defines a dimensionless location in three-dimensional space.

properties.name: X
properties.description: Position along global X coordinate axis.

properties.name: Y

descriptionParts: An acoustics room is defined by the criteria related to the sound within the space, as well as its geometry

properties.name: Boundaries
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Geometry.PolySurface:  A composite surface constructed by combining a collection of surfaces of any type. Whole PolySurface integrity, continuity and closure is not guaranteed at creation. Discontinuous and/or multi-region definitions are possible, although validity of some engine methods may vary depending on the PolySurface form.

properties.name: AcousticZone
properties.description: This specifies the list of spaces associated with a particular occupant activity's acoustic criteria.

properties.name: PublicAddressVoiceAlarmZone
properties.description: This specifies the list of spaces associated with similar Public Address and Voice Alarm devices

properties.name: AverageInternalAmbientNoiseLevelRequirement
properties.description: This acoustic requirement specificies the maximum equivalent continuous noise level of a time-varying noise (LAeq,T) within a space. This metric is usually composed of noise from many sources, near and far and is measured in A-weighted decibels (dBA).

properties.name: MaximumInternalAmbientNoiseLevelRequirement
properties.description: This acoustic requirement specifies the maximum sound pressure level within a space (LAF,max). It is typically measured using the fast time constant in A-weighted decibels (dBA).

properties.name: ReverberationTime
properties.description: This acoustic requirement specifies the maximum time for a steady sound pressure level in an enclosed space to decay by 60 dB. This parameter is measured in second from the moment the sound source is switched off.

properties.name: NoiseRating
properties.description: Noise rating curves developed by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) determine the acceptable indoor environment for hearing preservation, speech communication and annoyance. This requirement specifies the maximum noise rating for a space.

properties.name: ImpactSoundInsulation
properties.description: This specifies the required impact sound insulation performance for floors. The single figure target value is typically given in for in-situ field measurements (L'nTw) in decibels. The lower the L'nTw, the better the building element will attenuate impact noises.

properties.name: SpeechTransmitionIndex
properties.description: Speech transmission index (STI) is a metric that represents the transmission quality of speech with respect to intelligibility by a speech transmission channel. This acoustic requirement specifies the minimum STI ranging between 0 and 1.

properties.name: PrivacyRequirement
properties.description: This specifies the acoustic privacy requirements of a space. Acoustic privacy for a space is rated according to the noise sensitivity of a receiving room and the level of activity noise within a source room. It is typically denoted by terms Not Private, Moderate and Confidential, and is used to determine the suitable level of sound insulation (DnT,w) for partitions between spaces.

properties.name: MinimumSoundPressureLevel
properties.description: This acoustic criterion specifies the minimum sound pressure level required at an audience plane from a Public Address or Voice Alarm system, in decibels.

properties.name: SoundPressureLevelCoverage
properties.description: This acoustic criterion specifies the minimum coverage area of an audience plane that must attain the Public Address or Voice Alarm MinimumSoundPressureLevel requirement. Typically given as a proportion, input a requirement value between 0-1. e.g. 80% coverage = 0.8.

properties.name: AcousticUnderlayRequirement
properties.description: By selecting 'True' this boolean indicates the areas of a development that must utilise acoustic underlay in order to attain a suitable impact sound insulation performance (considering the activity in the source rooms and the sensitivity of the receiver room).

properties.name: Revision_to
properties.description: Revision Id that this Delta produces.

properties.name: Timestamp
properties.description: In UTC ticks.

properties.name: Author
properties.description: Any descriptive string identifying either the Author and/or the software used.

descriptionParts: Represents the differences between two sets of objects.

properties.name: AddedObjects
properties.description: Objects present in the second set that are not present in the first set.

properties.name: RemovedObjects
properties.description: Objects not present in the second set that were present in the first set.

properties.name: ModifiedObjects
properties.description: Objects that are recognised as present both in the first set and the second set, but that have some property that is different. The rules that were used to recognise modification are in the `DiffingConfig.ComparisonConfig`.

properties.name: UnchangedObjects
properties.description: Objects that are recognised as the same in the first and second set.

properties.name: ModifiedPropsPerObject
properties.description: The Key is the modified object hash. The Value is another Dictionary, whose Key is the name of the modified property, while Value.Item1 is the property value in setA, Value.Item2 in setB. This dictionary may be exploded by using BH.Engine.Diffing.Query.ListModifiedProperties().

properties.name: DiffingConfig
properties.description: Default diffing settings for this Stream. Hashes of objects contained in this stream will be computed based on these configs.  This is a BH.oM.Diffing.DiffingConfig:  General configurations for the Diffing process, including settings for the Hash computation.

descriptionParts: What type of Diffing should be computed.
Enum values:
-Automatic: Automatic: tries, in sequence, diffing with PersistentId, OneByOne, Hash.
-Revision: Revision: for the Stream-revision workflow. The Diffing considers different Revisions of a Stream (a set of object that changed in time).

-PersistentId: PersistentId: uses the PersistentId stored in the Fragments of the BHoMObjects, if present. If more than one PersistentId is found on the objects, a PersistentId type must be specified in the DiffConfig.
-OneByOne: OneByOne: assuming the input collections are of the same length, this compares objects one by one.

-Hash: Hash: compares by using the object hashes. If there is already a HashFragment stored in the BHoMObjects, by default that is used. Otherwise, hash is computed for every object, and then by default it gets stored in the BHoMObjects. Default behaviours can be changed in the DiffConfig.
-CustomDataId: CustomData: uses an Id stored under the BHoMObjects CustomData.
Stores the current and previous Hash of the parent BHoMObject, as assigned after the inclusion in a Revision.

properties.name: Hash
properties.description: Current object Hash.

properties.name: PreviousHash
properties.description: Previous object Hash, typically the one it had in its previous Revision.

descriptionParts: General configurations for the Diffing process, including settings for the Hash computation.

properties.name: ComparisonConfig
properties.description: Settings to determine the uniqueness of an Object.  This is a BH.oM.Base.ComparisonConfig:  Settings to determine the uniqueness of an Object.

properties.name: EnablePropertyDiffing
properties.description: Enables the property-level diffing: differences in object properties are stored in the `ModifiedPropsPerObject` dictionary.

properties.name: MaxPropertyDifferences
properties.description: If EnablePropertyDiffing is true, this sets the maximum number of differences to be determine before stopping. Useful to limit the run time. Defaults to 1000.

properties.name: IncludeUnchangedObjects
properties.description: If enabled, the Diff includes also the objects that did not change (`Unchanged`).

properties.name: PersistentIdType
properties.description: Type of PersistentId that should be used to perform the Diffing.

properties.name: CustomDataKey
properties.description: Key of the CustomData dictionary where to look for an Id to use for the Diffing.

descriptionParts: Points to a specific Stream. Can be used to generate a new Stream and StreamId.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

properties.name: StreamId
properties.description: Id of the Stream that owns this Revision.

properties.name: RevisionId
properties.description: Unique GUID of this Revision.

properties.name: RevisionName
properties.description: Name assigned to this Revision. It may be descriptive of the changes included in this Revision, e.g. AddedBasementColumns.

properties.name: Timestamp
properties.description: In UTC.Now ticks. Automatically defined when creating a new Revision.

properties.name: Author
properties.description: Author of the Stream Revision. Automatically calculated as it should be univocally defined.

properties.name: Comment
properties.description: Any comment to be added on this this Revision.

properties.name: Objects
properties.description: Objects to be included in this Revision.

properties.name: RevisionDiffConfing
properties.description: Diffing settings for this Revision. Hashes of objects contained in this stream will be computed based on these configs.  This is a BH.oM.Diffing.DiffingConfig:  General configurations for the Diffing process, including settings for the Hash computation.

properties.name: ClassName
properties.description: The EnergyPlus Class name for the object - serialised to the IDF string. DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: Vegetation material name. Default is Grass

properties.name: HeightOfPlants
properties.description: This field defines the height of plants in units of meters. This field is limited to values in the range 0.005 < Height < 1.00 m. Default is .2 m.

properties.name: LeafAreaIndex
properties.description: This is the projected leaf area per unit area of soil surface. This field is dimensionless and is limited to values in the range of 0.001 < LAI < 5.0. Default is 1.71 for grass. At the present time the fraction vegetation cover is calculated directly from LAI (Leaf Area Index) using an empirical relation. The user may find it necessary to increase the specified value of LAI in order to represent high fractional coverage of the surface by vegetation.

properties.name: LeafReflectivity
properties.description: This field represents the fraction of incident solar radiation that is reflected by the individual leaf surfaces (albedo). Solar radiation includes the visible spectrum as well as infrared and ultraviolet wavelengths. Values for this field must be between 0.05 and 0.5. Typical values are .18 to .25.

properties.name: LeafEmissivity
properties.description: This field is the ratio of thermal radiation emitted from leaf surfaces to that emitted by an ideal black body at the same temperature. This parameter is used when calculating the long wavelength radiant exchange at the leaf surfaces. Values for this field must be between 0.8 and 1.0 (with 1.0 representing black body conditions). Default is .95.

properties.name: MinimumStomatalResistance
properties.description: This field represents the resistance of the plants to moisture transport. It has units of s/m. Plants with low values of stomatal resistance will result in higher evapotranspiration rates than plants with high resistance. Values for this field must be in the range of 50.0 to 300.0. Default is 180.

properties.name: SoilLayerName
properties.description: This field is a unique reference name that the user assigns to the soil layer for a particular ecoroof. This name can then be referred to by other input data. Default is Soil

properties.name: Roughness
properties.description: This alpha field defines the relative roughness of a particular material layer. This parameter only influences the convection coefficients, more specifically the exterior convection coefficient. A keyword is expected in this field with the options being VeryRough, Rough, MediumRough, MediumSmooth, Smooth, and VerySmooth in order of roughest to smoothest options. Default is MediumRough.

properties.name: Thickness
properties.description: This field characterizes the thickness of the material layer in meters. This should be the dimension of the layer in the direction perpendicular to the main path of heat conduction. This value must be a positive number. Depths of .10m (4 inches) and .15m (6 inches) are common. Default if this field is left blank is .1. Maximum is .7m. Must be greater than .05 m.

properties.name: ConductivityOfDrySoil
properties.description: This field is used to enter the thermal conductivity of the material layer. Units for this parameter are W/(m-K). Thermal conductivity must be greater than zero. Typical soils have values from .3 to .5. Minimum is .2 (specified in IDD). and maximum (in IDD) is 1.5.

properties.name: DensityOfDrySoil
properties.description: This field is used to enter the density of the material layer in units of kg/m3. Density must be a positive quantity. Typical soils range from 400 to 1000 (dry to wet).Minimum is 300, maximum is 2000 and default if field is left blank is 1250.

properties.name: SpecificHeatOfDrySoil
properties.description: This field represents the specific heat of the material layer in units of J/(kg-K). Note that these units are most likely different than those reported in textbooks and references which tend to use kJ/(kg-K) or J/(g-K). They were chosen for internal consistency within EnergyPlus. Only positive values of specific heat are allowed.

properties.name: ThermalAbsorptance
properties.description: The thermal absorptance field in the Material input syntax represents the fraction of incident long wavelength (>2.5 microns) radiation that is absorbed by the material. This parameter is used when calculating the long wavelength radiant exchange between various surfaces and affects the surface heat balances (both inside and outside as appropriate). For long wavelength radiant exchange, thermal emissivity and thermal emittance are equal to thermal absorptance. Values for this field must be between 0.0 and 1.0 (with 1.0 representing black body conditions). Typical values are from .9 to .98. The default value for this field is 0.92.

properties.name: SolarAbsorptance
properties.description: The solar absorptance field in the Material input syntax represents the fraction of incident solar radiation that is absorbed by the material. Solar radiation (0.3 to 2.537 microns) includes the visible spectrum as well as infrared and ultraviolet wavelengths. This parameter is used when calculating the amount of incident solar radiation absorbed by various surfaces and affects the surface heat balances (both inside and outside as appropriate). If solar reflectance (or reflectivity) data is available, then absorptance is equal to 1.0 minus reflectance (for opaque materials). Values for this field must be between 0.0 and 1.0. Typical values are from .6 to .85. The default value for this field is 0.75.

properties.name: VisibleAbsorptance
properties.description: The visible absorptance field in the Material input syntax represents the fraction of incident visible wavelength radiation that is absorbed by the material. Visible wavelength radiation ( 0.37 to 0.78 microns weighted by photopic response) is slightly different than solar radiation in that the visible band of wavelengths is much more narrow while solar radiation includes the visible spectrum as well as infrared and ultraviolet wavelengths. This parameter is used when calculating the amount of incident visible radiation absorbed by various surfaces and affects the surface heat balances (both inside and outside as appropriate) as well as the daylighting calculations. If visible reflectance (or reflectivity) data is available, then absorptance is equal to 1.0 minus reflectance (for opaque materials). Values for this field must be between 0.5 and 1.0. The default value for this field is 0.75.

properties.name: SaturationVolumetricMoistureContentOfTheSoilLayer
properties.description: The field allows for user input of the saturation moisture content of the soil layer. Maximum moisture content is typically less than .5. Range is [.1,.5] with the default being .3.

properties.name: ResidualVolumetricMoistureContentOfTheSoilLayer
properties.description: The field allows for user input of the residual moisture content of the soil layer. Default is .01, range is [.01,.1].

properties.name: InitialVolumetricMoistureContentOfTheSoilLayer
properties.description: The field allows for user input of the initial moisture content of the soil layer. Range is (.05, .5] with the default being .1.

properties.name: MoistureDiffusionCalculationMethod
properties.description: The field allows for two models to be selected: Simple or Advanced. Simple is the original Ecoroof model - based on a constant diffusion of moisture through the soil.This model starts with the soil in two layers.Every time the soil properties update is called, it will look at the two soils moisture layers and asses which layer has more moisture in it.It then takes moisture from the higher moisture layer and redistributes it to the lower moisture layer at a constant rate. Advanced is the later Ecoroof model.If you use it, you will need to increase your number of timesteps in hour for the simulation with a recommended value of 20.This moisture transport model is based on a project which looked at the way moisture transports through soil.It uses a finite difference method to divide the soil into layers(nodes).It redistributes the soil moisture according the model described in: Marcel G Schaap and Martinus Th.van Genuchten, 2006, A modified Maulem - van Genuchten Formulation for Improved Description of the Hydraulic Conductivity Near Saturation, Vadose Zone Journal 5(1), p 27 - 34.

properties.name: Sensible
properties.description: The sensible heat contributed by equipment, which contributes to a rise in temperature with no change in phase.

properties.name: Latent
properties.description: The latent heat contributed by equipment, which contributes to a change in phase from solid to liquid.

properties.name: Profile
properties.description: Profiles depict the time period (hours per day, days per week) during which equipment is contributing heat to the space.  This is a BH.oM.Environment.SpaceCriteria.Profile:  A profile object represents a gain, thermostat or humdistat as conditions vary over a 24-hour period

properties.name: RadiantFraction
properties.description: The radiant fraction depicts the percentage of long wave radiant heat given off by equipment.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: Exhaust is indicative of the amount of air that should be extracted from a space based on the space type (eg laboratory, woodshop) or fixtures contained within the space (eg toilets, showers)

properties.name: AirChangeRate
properties.description: The air change rate per hour (ACH) is a value that denotes the amount of air that must be removed each hour, based on the volume of the space (1 ACH would be 1x the volume of space each hour, if the space is 1m3, it would be 1m3 of extract per hour)

properties.name: SpaceTypeContinuous
properties.description: The continuous exhaust rate associated with a particular space type (eg pet shop, printing room) measured in m3/s*m2

properties.name: UnitContinuous
properties.description: The exhaust rate associated with a particular fixture type (eg toilets, showers) that is run continuously, meaning that it is not triggered by a sensor or switch and is measured in m3/s*unit

properties.name: UnitIntermittent
properties.description: The exhaust rate associated with a particular fixture type (eg toilets, showers) that is run intermittently, meaning that it is triggered by a sensor or switch and is measured in m3/s*unit

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: Infiltration gains are defined as the amount of heat or heat loss contributed by cracks in the exterior envelope of the building which allow unconditioned outside air to be introduced to the space

properties.name: AirChangeRate
properties.description: The AirChangeRate indicates the amount of conditioned air lost by infiltration that should be replaced each hour, based on the volume of the space (1 ACH would be 1x the volume of space each hour, if the space is 1m3, it would be 1m3 of outside air per hour)

properties.name: AirflowByWallExternalArea
properties.description: The AirflowByWallExternalArea indicates the amount of air (m3/s) lost by infiltration based on the exterior wall area, that should be replaced within the space.

properties.name: AirflowByWallExternalCrackLength
properties.description: The AirflowByWallExternalCrackLength indicates the amount of air (m3/s) lost by infiltration based on the exterior wall crack length (the sum of the edge lengths), that should be replaced within the space.

properties.name: Profile
properties.description: Profiles depict the time period (hours per day, days per week) during which infiltration is contributing to or causing a loss of heat to the space.  This is a BH.oM.Environment.SpaceCriteria.Profile:  A profile object represents a gain, thermostat or humdistat as conditions vary over a 24-hour period

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: Lighting gains are defined as the amount of heat contributed by light fixtures

properties.name: Sensible
properties.description: The sensible heat contributed by light fixtures, which contributes to a rise in temperature with no change in phase.

properties.name: Profile
properties.description: Profiles depict the time period (hours per day, days per week) during which the lighting gain is contributing heat to the space.  This is a BH.oM.Environment.SpaceCriteria.Profile:  A profile object represents a gain, thermostat or humdistat as conditions vary over a 24-hour period

properties.name: RadiantFraction
properties.description: The radiant fraction depicts the percentage of long wave radiant heat given off by the light fixtures.

properties.name: LuminousEfficacy
properties.description: Luminous efficacy is a measure of how well a light fixture produces visible light

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: The fire protection attributes of a space are indicative of the hazard level of the space (which influences the sprinkler count), the sprinkler system type required, and the presence of combustible materials or sloped ceilings.

properties.name: HazardType
properties.description: Hazard Type indicates the combustibility of the materials within the space (Light, Ordinary or Extra). The indication of hazard type also determines the density of sprinklers required within the space.

properties.name: SprinklerSystemType
properties.description: Sprinkler System Type indicates whether the system will need to accommodate spaces that are subject to freezing (dry system type, commonly used in loading docks and parking garages), spaces that contain materials that when on fire would be spread further by water (foam system type, commonly used in a diesel generator room), spaces that contain precious materials that would be ruined by a false trip of the sprinkler system (preaction, commonly used in art galleries.)

properties.name: CombustibleMaterials
properties.description: The presence of combustible materials in the space would indicate the potential need for increasing the hazard type within the space.

properties.name: SlopedCeiling
properties.description: The presence of a sloped ceiling within the space would indicate the potential need for the area of the ceiling being calculated as if it were flat (i.e. the space would require more sprinklers than by area alone.)

properties.name: MaximumCeilingTemperature
properties.description: The maximum ceiling temperature indicates the temperature rating, classification and color of the sprinklers within the space.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: The plumbing attributes of a space are indicative of the amount of cold water, hot water and waste required by a space, as well as requirements for vent, floor drains, hose bibs or natural gas

properties.name: ColdWaterUnits
properties.description: The total number of cold water units (aka fixture units or loading units) that should be provided to the space based on the number of plumbing fixtures requiring cold water within the space (e.g. 1 sink = 1.0 units, 2 sinks = 2.0 units, 1 urinal = 10.0 units per IPC2015 Table E103.3).

properties.name: HotWaterUnits
properties.description: The total number of hot water units (aka fixture units or loading units) that should be provided to the space based on the number of plumbing fixtures requiring hot water within the space (e.g. 1 sink = 1.0 units, 2 sinks = 2.0 units, 1 urinal = 0.0 units (no hot water for urinals!) per IPC2015 Table E103.3).

properties.name: WasteUnits
properties.description: The total number of waste/sanitary/drainage units (aka fixture units or loading units) that should be provided to the space based on the number of plumbing fixtures requiring waste/sanitary/drainage connections within the space (e.g. 1 sink = 2.0 units, 2 sinks = 4.0 units, 1 urinal = 4.0 units per IPC2018 Table 709.1).

properties.name: NaturalGasRate
properties.description: The natural gas rate will indicate the m3/hr of gas required within the space incurred by stovetops, fireplaces or clothes dryers.

properties.name: VentRequirement
properties.description: An indication that the space will require vent (inherently linked to the need for waste/sanitary/drainage) the size will be calculated based on the number of waste units required.

properties.name: FloorDrainRequirement
properties.description: An indication that the space will require floor drains (janitor's closet or mechanical room).

properties.name: HoseBibRequirement
properties.description: An indication that the space will require hose bibs (janitor's closet or mechanical room).

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: People gains are defined as the amount of both latent and sensible heat contributed by people based on their assumed activity level within the space (dancing, sitting, etc)

properties.name: Sensible
properties.description: The sensible heat contributed by people, which contributes to a rise in temperature with no change in phase.

properties.name: Latent
properties.description: The latent heat contributed by people, which contributes to a change in phase from solid to liquid.

properties.name: Profile
properties.description: Profiles depict the time period (hours per day, days per week) during which people are contributing heat to the space.  This is a BH.oM.Environment.SpaceCriteria.Profile:  A profile object represents a gain, thermostat or humdistat as conditions vary over a 24-hour period

properties.name: RadiantFraction
properties.description: The radiant fraction depicts the percentage of long wave radiant heat given off by people.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: Plug gains are defined as the amount of sensible heat contributed by electrical receptacle/outlet loads

properties.name: Sensible
properties.description: The sensible heat contributed by plugs, which contributes to a rise in temperature with no change in phase.

properties.name: Profile
properties.description: Profiles depict the time period (hours per day, days per week) during which plug loads are contributing heat to the space.  This is a BH.oM.Environment.SpaceCriteria.Profile:  A profile object represents a gain, thermostat or humdistat as conditions vary over a 24-hour period

properties.name: RadiantFraction
properties.description: The radiant fraction depicts the percentage of long wave radiant heat given off by plugs.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: Pollutant gains are defined as the amount of both latent and sensible heat contributed by pollutution sources.

properties.name: Sensible
properties.description: The sensible heat contributed by pollutants, which contribute to a rise in temperature with no change in phase.

properties.name: Latent
properties.description: The latent heat contributed by pollutants, which contribute to a change in phase from solid to liquid.

properties.name: Profile
properties.description: Profiles depict the time period (hours per day, days per week) during which pollutants are contributing heat to the space.  This is a BH.oM.Environment.SpaceCriteria.Profile:  A profile object represents a gain, thermostat or humdistat as conditions vary over a 24-hour period

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: Ventilation defines the amount of outside air that should be introduced to a space, which is typically based on the number of occupants breathing the air and the area of the space.

properties.name: PeopleRate
properties.description: The ventilation rate associated with the number of occupants within a space, example: 0.00025 m3/s per person

properties.name: AreaRate
properties.description: The ventilation rate associated with the area of the space, example: 0.0003 m3/s*m2

properties.name: AirChangeRate
properties.description: The air change rate per hour (ACH) is a value that denotes the amount of air that must be replaced each hour, based on the volume of the space (1 ACH would be 1x the volume of space each hour, if the space is 1m3, it would be 1m3 of outside air per hour)

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: A profile object represents a gain, thermostat or humdistat as conditions vary over a 24-hour period

properties.name: ProfileType
properties.description: Profile Type depicts the type of profile (OnOff (0 or 1), ModulatingPercentage (0.0-1.0), or Absolute (-10000 to +10000))

properties.name: ProfileDay
properties.description: Profile Day depicts the day described in the profile, whether it's a day of the week or a holiday

properties.name: HourlyValues
properties.description: Hourly Values denotes the hour-by-hour values for a 24-hour period. These values may be represented in temperature (degrees C) (thermostat), fraction (0.9) (lighting gain), or flow (m3/s) (ventilation)

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

properties.name: ProportionalControl
properties.description: Proportional control indicates that the thermostat can modulate the voltage delivered to the heating and/or cooling device

properties.name: ControlRange
properties.description: Control range indicates the range in temperature (in degrees of celsius)

properties.name: Profiles
properties.description: Profiles depict the time period (hours per day, days per week) during which the thermostat will be active.

properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: A space object is an analytical depiction of a room defined by its environmental conditions (internal gains)

properties.name: Zones
properties.description: Zones denotes the list of zones that this particular space is associated with. Zones are collections of spaces with similar internal gains and exterior envelope conditions.

properties.name: LightingGain
properties.description: Lighting gains are objects that are defined as the amount of heat contributed by light fixtures within the space

properties.name: EquipmentGain
properties.description: Equipment gains are objects that are defined as the amount of heat contributed by equipment within the space

properties.name: PeopleGain
properties.description: People gains are objects that are defined as the amount of heat contributed by people based on their assumed activity level within the space (dancing, sitting, etc)

properties.name: Infiltration
properties.description: Infiltration gains are objects that are defined as the amount of heat or heat loss contributed by cracks in the exterior envelope of the building which allow unconditioned outside air to be introduced to the space

properties.name: Ventilation
properties.description: Ventilation are objects that define the amount of outside air that should be introduced to a space, which is typically based on the number of occupants breathing the air and the area of the space.

properties.name: Exhaust
properties.description: Exhaust are objects that define the amount of air that should be extracted from a space, which is either based on the objects within the space (toilets, showers) or the space type (kitchen, bathroom).

properties.name: OccupantDensity
properties.description: Occupant Density is an object that defines the area occupied by each individual in a space (2 m2 per person).  This is a BH.oM.Architecture.Elements.Occupancy

properties.name: Acoustics

properties.name: Plumbing

properties.name: FireProtection

Resulting section forces in local coordinates along the bar.

properties.name: FX
properties.description: Axial force along the local x-axis. Positive for tension, negative for compression.

properties.name: FY
properties.description: Shear force along the local y-axis. Generally minor axis shear force.

properties.name: FZ
properties.description: Shear force along the local z-axis. Generally major axis shear force.

properties.name: MX
properties.description: Torsional moment.

properties.name: MY
properties.description: Bending moment about the local y-axis. Generally major axis bending moment.

properties.name: MZ
properties.description: Bending moment about the local z-axis. Generally minor axis bending moment.

properties.name: ObjectId
properties.description: Id of the bar that this result belongs to. When extracted from an analysis package, the object id will match the format and value used in that particular package.

properties.name: ResultCase
properties.description: Identifier for the Loadcase or LoadCombination that the result belongs to. Is generally name or number of the loadcase, depending on the analysis package.

properties.name: ModeNumber
properties.description: Positive index, starting at one. Only set for cases with modal outputs such as dynamic cases.

properties.name: TimeStep
properties.description: Time step for time history results.

properties.name: Position
properties.description: Position on the bar as normalised length, i.e. 0 for start, 1 for end and 0.5 for middle.

properties.name: Divisions
properties.description: How many division points along the bar was used when extracting this result. This generally means that this many results with the same ObjectId, ResultCase and TimeStep was extracted.

properties.name: RigidZoneFactor
properties.description: Value descibing the factor of the rigid zone. Needs to be between 0 and 1

descriptionParts: Render geometry with a specific colour.

properties.name: Geometry
properties.description: A geometry (or many geometry objects collected into a single `CompositeGeometry` object).  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.IGeometry:  The parent interface for all primative geometrical objects. IGeometry implements IObject - and not IBHoMObject. Equally primative geometrical objects do not inherit from the base BHoMObject class either. As primatives, the additional base BHoM properties are omitted for both efficency and performace.  This can be of the following types: Arc, Circle, Ellipse, Line, NurbsCurve, PolyCurve, Polyline, Face, CellRelation, Mesh3D, Mesh, BoundingBox, CompositeGeometry, Quaternion, SurfaceTrim, and more...

properties.name: Colour
properties.description: Colour used to render the Geometry. Default is BHoM Coral with a subtle transparency (Color.FromArgb(80, 255, 41, 105)).

descriptionParts: Render text at a location and orientation in space with specified height, font and colour.

properties.name: Text
properties.description: The text to render.

properties.name: Cartesian
properties.description: Cartesian to locate and orientate the text.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.CoordinateSystem.Cartesian:  A three-dimensional Cartesian coordinate system, as defined by a set of mutually orthogonal unit vectors and a common origin point

properties.name: Height
properties.description: Height of the text. Default is 1. Units will be determined by the setting of the user interface that renders the text.

properties.name: FontName
properties.description: Font used to render the text. Default is Arial.

properties.name: Colour
properties.description: Colour used to render the text. Default is BHoM Coral with a subtle transparency (Color.FromArgb(80, 255, 41, 105)).

descriptionParts: Defines options for the Representation of BHoM Objects.

properties.name: Detailed0DElements
properties.description: If true, 0D elements are detailed. If `true`, Points are represented by Spheres. For discipline-specific objects, `true` may correspond to e.g. a composite geometry computed based on their properties.

properties.name: Element0DScale
properties.description: Scale the Element0D representation.

properties.name: Detailed1DElements
properties.description: If true, 1D elements are detailed. If `true`, Lines are represented by Pipes. For discipline-specific objects, `true` may correspond to e.g. an Extrusion using a cross section property; `false` to pipe using a centreline.

properties.name: Element1DScale
properties.description: Scale the Element1D representation, if applicable. For Lines, this increases the Pipe size. Discipline-specific representations might not be affected by this parameter.

properties.name: Cap1DElements
properties.description: Cap 1D elements, if applicable. E.g. for a Line, this caps the computed Pipe. For discipline-specific objects, it may e.g. cap the Extrusions of their cross section.

properties.name: Detailed2DElements
properties.description: If true, 2D elements are detailed. For discipline-specific objects, `true` may correspond to e.g. a box-like geometry representing the 2D element with their thickness, based on its cross section; `false` to e.g. their the middle surface.

properties.description: Regulates the refinement of Pipe meshes for 1DElements, i.e. the number of faces of the Pipes.

properties.name: Element2DRefinement
properties.description: Regulates the refinement of surface meshes for 2DElements.

descriptionParts: Either do not centre the range of the gradient, extend the range to be centred around 0, or make 0 the midpoint of the gradient while keeping UpperBound and LowerBound as the ends.

-Symmetric: Extend range to be centred around 0.

Controls which type of analysis solver used for a Loadcombination.
Enum values:
-LinearStatic: Standard linear static solver.
-NonLinearStatic: Full non linear solver making use of the dynamic relaxtion solver.
-FormFinding: Formfinding, using dynamic relaxtion, updating geometry and pre-stress values of the model.
-SoapFilm: Formfinding, using dynamic relaxtion, updating geometry to match specified pre-stress.

properties.name: WeftModulus

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

properties.name: EffectiveConeOfVision
properties.description: Reference Cone of Vision used for all Spectators. This is equivalent to the curve generated from the intersection of the near clipping plane and the viewing frustum.It should be planar and closed and in a plane parallel to the global XY Plane.Default value is a square based frustum with 30 degree field of view and near clipping plane 0.1 from the eye reference location. Giving a a 0.115 * 0.115 square EffectiveConeOfVision.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Polyline:  A curve consisting of a continuous chain of straight line segments. The Polyline is considered closed if the first and last ControlPoints are coincident

properties.name: FarClippingPlaneDistance
properties.description: The distance from a spectator to the far clipping plane of their view frustum. Spectators in front of this plane will not be used in the occlusion part of the Avalue calculation. Default value is 1.

properties.name: CalculateOcclusion
properties.description: Calculate proportion of playing area obstructed by heads of Spectators in front. Default value is false

properties.name: EffectiveConeOfVisionWidth
properties.description: Width of default EffectiveConeOfVision. Default value is 0.115. Used only when no EffectiveConeOfVision is provided.

properties.name: EffectiveConeOfVisionHeight
properties.description: Height of default EffectiveConeOfVision. Default value is 0.115. Used only when no EffectiveConeOfVision is provided.

properties.name: NearClippingPlaneDistance
properties.description: The distance from a spectator to the near clipping plane of their view frustum. Default value is 0.1. Used only when no EffectiveConeOfVision is provided.

properties.name: FocalPoint
properties.description: Optional focal point to set the view direction of the spectators. If none provided the Avalue is calculated using the neutral viewing direction of each spectator.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Point:  Defines a dimensionless location in three-dimensional space.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

properties.name: DefaultCValue
properties.description: Value assigned to spectators where Cvalue cannot be calculated, for example on a front row.

properties.name: FarClippingPlaneDistance
properties.description: The distance from a spectator to the far clipping plane of their view frustum. Spectators in front of this plane will not be used in the Cvalue calculation.

properties.name: ViewConeAngle
properties.description: Spectator view cone angle in radians. Default is approximately 2.0944 radians or 120 degrees. Field of view for a spectator, within which spectators in front are consider to be effectively blocking the view and used for the Cvalue calcualtion.

descriptionParts: This Config can be specified in the `ActionConfig` input of any Adapter Action (e.g. Push).

properties.name: Id
properties.description: Specifies ID of the Audit to search for.

properties.name: AssetFilePath
properties.description: Path to pull/push media assets to/from that relate to the audit.

properties.name: IncludeAssetFiles
properties.description: Set to true to download / upload asset file sassociated with the audit.

properties.name: WrapNonBHoMObjects
properties.description: If true, the Push action wraps any non-BHoM type into a BH.oM.Adapter.ObjectWrapper, allowing them to make use of the full Adapter workflow.

properties.name: AllowHashForComparing
properties.description: If true and if no specific EqualityComparer is found for the type, Diffing hashes are computed and used to compare the objects.

properties.name: DiffingConfig
properties.description: Configurations for the Diffing hashing. Requires `AllowHashForComparing` to be set to true.  This is a BH.oM.Diffing.DiffingConfig:  General configurations for the Diffing process, including settings for the Hash computation.

descriptionParts: Create a SettingsIES object for use with the IES Adapter

properties.name: PlanarTolerance
properties.description: Set tolarance for planar surfaces, default is set to BH.oM.Geometry.Tolerance.Distance

properties.name: DecimalPlaces
properties.description: Set how many decimal places coordinates should have on export, default is set to 6

properties.name: PullOpenings
properties.description: Determine whether or not openings should be pulled from the GEM file when pulling a GEM file. Only valid if pulling Panels which host openings. Default is True, to pull openings when pulling panels.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: A comment on an Issue typically identifying either the nature of the issue, the actions being taken to resolve the issue, or the approval / rejection of actions taken.

properties.name: Message
properties.description: Comment message

properties.name: Owner
properties.description: Name of the individual making the comment

properties.name: CommentDate
properties.description: Date the comment was made

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: An issue belonging to an audit

properties.name: IssueNumber
properties.description: Issue number to identify this specific issue. This is typically a combination of the audit number and the issue number within its audit.

properties.name: DateCreated
properties.description: Date the issue was initially created

properties.name: DateClosed
properties.description: Date the issue was Closed

properties.name: Priority
properties.description: Priority tag to better categorize your issue  identifying its urgency

properties.name: Status
properties.description: Status description of the issue (eg open, in progress, closed)

properties.name: Assign
properties.description: A list of assignees for the issue. These are the individuals / companies responsible for resolving the issue.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: Issue type (eg For Information)

properties.name: Description
properties.description: The scope and nature of the issue

properties.name: Media
properties.description: Filenames of the images associated with the issue.These must include the file extension.

properties.name: Position
properties.description: Location of the issue in 3D space in terms of the project's coordinate system  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Point:  Defines a dimensionless location in three-dimensional space.

properties.name: Comments
properties.description: List of comments made on the issue, identifying either the nature of the issue, the actions being taken to resolve the issue, or the approval / rejection of actions taken.

properties.name: AuditID
properties.description: Unique ID of Audit the Issue was originally recorded within.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: Installation progress in a specific area associated with an audit, including image filepaths as applicable

properties.name: Status
properties.description: The general status of installation progress at the time of the inspection.

properties.name: Area
properties.description: Description for the area that this installation progress refers to.

properties.name: Media
properties.description: Filenames of images showing the construction progress in the area specified.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: An audit that covers all information associated with a single inspection. This includes issues, areas inspected, project information, construction progress, and distribution information.

properties.name: Title
properties.description: Title of Audit (typically the project name or name of a specific scope of the project)

properties.name: Filename
properties.description: Filename of Audit used to identify it when saved to reports or other formats

properties.name: AuditID
properties.description: Unique ID of Audit provided by the Audit's source

properties.name: SiteVisitNumber
properties.description: Site Visit Number of the Audit (this is a sequential number corresponding to the amount of audits conducted for this project up to this point)

properties.name: Client
properties.description: Client for which the Audit is being recorded

properties.name: RevisionNumber
properties.description: Revision Number of the Audit (typically 0, only used when the information related to a specific audit is revised)

properties.name: InspectionDate
properties.description: Date the Audit was conducted in local time.

properties.name: InspectionDateUtc
properties.description: Date the Audit was conducted in UTC time.

properties.name: IssueDate
properties.description: Date the Audit was issued in local time.

properties.name: IssueDateUtc
properties.description: Date the Audit was issued in UTC time.

properties.name: Author
properties.description: Creator of the Audit

properties.name: ProjectNumber
properties.description: Project Number of the Project the Audit is for

properties.name: JobLeader
properties.description: Job leader of the Project the Audit is for

properties.name: Distribution
properties.description: List of people the Audit is distributed to

properties.name: Attendance
properties.description: List of people in attendance during audit

properties.name: VisitPurpose
properties.description: Reason(s) for visit and audit

properties.name: AreasInspected
properties.description: List of areas inspected throughout the audit

properties.name: InstallationProgressObjects
properties.description: Installation progress objects from the audit (Each of these corresponds to the status of a specific area inspected)

properties.name: IssueNumbers
properties.description: Issues from audit. These are reference IssueNumbers to corresponding issues identified during the audit for various areas that need to be addressed, which can include supporting images of the work as applicable.

properties.name: Score
properties.description: Score as a percentage. This represents the amount of issues / areas that have been resolved, and is an optional value not used by all audits.

descriptionParts: The Type of Environmental Product Declaration.

-Undefined
-Product

An Environmental Metric is used to store data regarding the environmental impacts of a given Environmental Product Declaration.
An EPD can host multiple EnvironmentalMetrics to describe the overall impact which will be used in any LCA calculation.

properties.name: Field
properties.description: An Environmental Impact Metric filter used to classify the Environmental Metric that is being stored on the EPD.

properties.name: Phases
properties.description: Phase of life abbreviation for the scope of the EPD. A single EnvironmentalMetric can contain either a single Phase or a list of Phases i.e. A1, A2, A3.

properties.name: Quantity
properties.description: The amount of the specified Field.
