Fire Protection Scope provides a template for expected objects to be assessed within the MEPScope

properties.name: Equipment
properties.description: Fire protection equipment includes both fire and jockey pumps which convey water through the fire protection system

properties.name: Pipes
properties.description: Distribution systems that convey fluids in the case of fire (e.g. domestic cold water).

properties.name: Sprinklers
properties.description: Sprinklers are devices that release water upon the detection of a fire.

properties.name: Tanks
properties.description: Tanks are containers that store water for fire protection.

properties.name: AdditionalObjects
properties.description: List of additional user objects that either do not fit within the established categories, or are not explicitly modelled (e.g. fire hose valve cabinets)

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: The Enclosures Scope object provides a template for expected objects commonly assessed within Life Cycle Assessments. Please provide as many objects with their corresponding Environmental Product Declaration data for the most accurate Life Cycle Assessment.

properties.name: Walls
properties.description: Enclosure walls are inclusive of the opaque exterior wall assemblies of a building

properties.name: CurtainWalls
properties.description: Enclosure curtain walls are large sheets of transparent glazing on the building exterior

properties.name: Windows
properties.description: Enclosure windows are are openings in the building exterior, which consist of framing and glazing

properties.name: Doors
properties.description: Enclosure doors are are openings in the building exterior, which consist of framing and panels

properties.name: AdditionalObjects
properties.description: List of additional user objects that either do not fit within the established categories, or are not explicitly modelled

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: The Foundations Scope object provides a template for expected objects commonly assessed within Life Cycle Assessments. Please provide as many objects with their corresponding Environmental Product Declaration data for the most accurate Life Cycle Assessment.

properties.name: Columns
properties.description: Foundation columns are typically vertical elements that carry the load of floors, roofs, and ceilings

properties.name: Footings
properties.description: Foundation footings (or pile caps) are mats below the buildings piles that help to distribute the load from the structure above

properties.name: Piles
properties.description: Foundation piles are structural supports that are driven into the ground below a building to support the building structure

properties.name: Walls
properties.description: Foundation walls are structural walls built below-grade

properties.name: Slabs
properties.description: Foundation slabs are structural slabs upon which the building is constructed. This category expects any type of slab, but assumes no construction properties

properties.name: GradeBeams
properties.description: Foundation grade beams transmit load from a bearing wall into foundations

properties.name: AdditionalObjects
properties.description: List of additional user objects that either do not fit within the established categories, or are not explicitly modelled

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: The Life Cycle Assessment Scope object intends to provide a means of reporting all of the project criteria (name, area, type, location). This object may be used for studies at any stage of development and can serve as a true means of 'apples to apples' comparison when catalogued. The information provided within this object is utilised for database construction and organisation only, therefore all values will not effect the overall life cycle assessment results.

properties.name: AdditionalNotes
properties.description: Additional notes should convey project design constraints (eg design for seismic activity) that could affect the overall embodied carbon.

properties.name: BiogenicCarbon
properties.description: Biogenic Carbon is a true/false that indicates that the project contains materials that originated from a biological source (trees, soil), these materials have the ability sequester/store carbon.

properties.name: BuildingLifespan
properties.description: The assumed lifespan of the building being evaluated.  These values are for categorisation purposes only and will not effect the overall results.

properties.name: ConstructionScopeNew
properties.description: Identifies the overall construction scope for the project. Set True if New Construction exists within your project.

properties.name: ConstructionScopeRenovation
properties.description: Identifies the overall construction scope for the project. Set True if Renovation exists within your project.

properties.name: ContactName
properties.description: The Contact Name denotes the person/people who performed the LCA study.

properties.name: GravityStructuralMaterial
properties.description: The primary structural system providing gravity support for the building.

properties.name: LateralStructuralMaterial
properties.description: The primary structural system providing lateral support for the building.

properties.name: LevelOfDevelopment
properties.description: Typically a term utilised in BIM practices to clearly identify the scope of work being account for. Equivalents for LOD classifications can offen times be linked to design and construction phases common to the projects locale.

properties.name: LifeCycleAssessmentPhases
properties.description: This is a list of life cycle assessment phases to be accounted for within this assessment. These values are for categorisation purposes only and will not effect the overall results.

properties.name: ProjectType
properties.description: A general classification of the buildings primary function. This value is for categorisation purposes only and will not effect the overall results.

properties.name: ProjectName
properties.description: The Project Name denotes the name of the project for reporting purposes.

properties.name: ProjectArea
properties.description: The Project Area (m2) denotes the more precise project area which will allow assessment of kgCO2eq/m2 metrics.

properties.name: SeismicDesignCategory
properties.description: Seismic Design Category is a classification assigned to a structure based on it's occupancy category, and the severity of the design earthquake ground motion. These categories are currently in reference to ASCE 7-05.

properties.name: WindSpeedCategory
properties.description: Wind speed category is in reference to the Beaufort Scale of wind speeds. Values are arranged from 0-12 equivalent, 0 being Calm and 12 being Hurricane, and are used only to represent an average site-based, wind condition. Specific informaion on categorisation can be found at https://www.spc.noaa.gov/faq/tornado/beaufort.html

properties.name: Location
properties.description: Provide the projects geographic location for database organisation purposes. This value is for categorisation purposes only and will not effect the overall results.  This is a BH.oM.Environment.Climate.Location:  Defines a uniquely identifiable point on the Earth in standard global Latitude, Longitude and Elevation, coordinate system. Particularly useful for specifying local climate conditions for environmental analysis.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: Mechanical Scope provides a template for expected objects to be assessed within the MEPScope

properties.name: AirTerminals
properties.description: Air terminals are the terminal devices for airflow systems (e.g. grilles, diffusers, registers)

properties.name: Dampers
properties.description: Dampers are devices that control the flow within a mechanical duct system (e.g. fire smoke dampers, volume dampers)

properties.name: Ducts
properties.description: Mechanical distribution system that convey airflow from heating, ventilation or cooling systems (e.g. supply air, extract air, return air)

properties.name: Equipment
properties.description: Mechanical equipment includes machines and devices that provide heating, cooling, venting, pumping etc. (e.g. chillers, fans, AHUs, pumps)

properties.name: Pipes
properties.description: Mechanical pipework includes distribution systems that convey fluids for mechanical heating or cooling (e.g. chilled water, heating hot water, refrigerant)

properties.name: Refrigerants
properties.description: Refrigerant is a fluid conveyed in refrigeration systems, it is generally a CFC or HCFC laden material (e.g. R-410A, R-22)

properties.name: Tanks
properties.description: Tanks are containers for mechanically conveyed fluids (e.g. diesel tanks that store fuel for generators).

properties.name: Valves
properties.description: Valves are devices that control the flow or pressure within a mechanical piping system (e.g. ball valve, globe valve, gate valve).

properties.name: AdditionalObjects
properties.description: List of additional user objects that either do not fit within the established categories, or are not explicitly modelled (e.g. hangers, brackets, filters)

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: Electrical Scope provides a template for expected objects to be assessed within the MEPScope

properties.name: Batteries
properties.description: Batteries include energy storage devices (e.g. lithium-ion batteries)

properties.name: CableTrays
properties.description: Cable trays are used to route electrical wiring throughout a building

properties.name: Conduit
properties.description: Conduit is used for electrical service routing of wires and includes tubing or channel

properties.name: Equipment
properties.description: Electrical Equipment includes machines or devices that comprise the electrical infrastructure (e.g. switchgear, panels, transformers, automatic transfer switches).

properties.name: FireAlarmDevices
properties.description: Fire alarm devices detect and alert the presence of smoke, fire or carbon monoxide (e.g. smoke alarm, audio visual devices).

properties.name: Generators
properties.description: Generators are devices that convert mechanical energy to electrical energy

properties.name: InformationCommunicationDevices
properties.description: Information Communication devices provide a means of passing data (e.g. data outlets, wireless access points, racks, patch panels).

properties.name: LightFixtures
properties.description: Devices that provide and distribute illumination

properties.name: LightingControls
properties.description: Devices that provide control of lighting fixtures

properties.name: Meters
properties.description: Meters are devices that measure electrical energy consumed.

properties.name: SecurityDevices
properties.description: Security devices alert or prevent movement between areas of a building (e.g. CCTV cameras, door access control).

properties.name: Sockets
properties.description: Electrical sockets are devices that serve as outlets for electrical energy (e.g. receptacles, plugs).

properties.name: SolarPanels
properties.description: Solar panels are panels that consist of photovoltaic cells that convert sunlight to electricity.

properties.name: WireSegments
properties.description: The system of distribution cabling that conveys electricity

properties.name: AdditionalObjects
properties.description: List of additional user objects that either do not fit within the established categories, or are not explicitly modelled

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: Plumbing Scope provides a template for expected objects to be assessed within the MEPScope

properties.name: Equipment
properties.description: Plumbing equipment includes machines or devices that pump, store or process water, gas or waste.

properties.name: Pipes
properties.description: Plumbing pipework includes distribution systems that convey fluids (e.g. domestic cold water, hot water, gas, vent, waste).

properties.name: PlumbingFixtures
properties.description: Plumbing fixtures are devices that convey and/or accept water, waste or gas (e.g. toilets, lavatories, urinals, drinking fountains).

properties.name: Tanks
properties.description: Tanks are containers for plumbing fluids (e.g. storm detention tanks, domestic water tanks).

properties.name: Valves
properties.description: Valves are devices that control the flow or pressure within a plumbing piping system (e.g. ball valve, globe valve, gate valve).

properties.name: AdditionalObjects
properties.description: List of additional user objects that either do not fit within the established categories, or are not explicitly modelled

This object may be used for studies at any stage of development and can serve as a true means of 'apples to apples' comparison when catalogued. The information provided within this object is utilised for database construction and organisation only, therefore all values will not effect the overall life cycle assessment results.

descriptionParts: An Environmental Product Declaration or EPD is an independently verified and registered document that communicates transparent and comparable information about the life-cycle environmental impact of products in a credible way.
More information can be found on the Environdec website (environdec.com/all-about-epds0/all-about-epds.)

All EPDs within the BHoM have been provided for general use and are updated as frequently as possible, but by using any supplied EPDs you assume all responsibility for the data used on any applications.
For additional comments, questions, or feature requests, please visit the LifeCycleAssessment_Toolkit at github.com/BHoM/LifeCycleAssessment_Toolkit.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: The Type of Environmental Product Declaration.

properties.name: EnvironmentalMetric
properties.description: An Environmental Metric to describe the type and quantity of a specified metric. These metrics are used in all LCA calculations.

properties.name: QuantityType
properties.description: Note that any EPD that does not contain this parameter will not be evaluated.  This metric is based on the declared unit of the reference EPD, i.e. a declared unit of kg refers to QuantityType of mass, a declared unit of m3 refers to a QuantityType of volume, etc.  All data should be normalized to metric declared units before integration in the BHoM.  The quantity type is a key metric for evaluation methods to function.  This property determines how the material is to be evaluated, based on Mass, Volume, Area, Item, or Length.

properties.name: QuantityTypeValue
properties.description: The number of units in reference to quantity type. Example, 1000 kg per unit quantityType of Mass.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: A data fragment used to store Density values if provided from the EPD source.
Density is a required property for all Evaluations of EPDs with Mass-QuantityType.Density can be changed by the user by adding this fragment to an EPD.
The user accepts responsibility for any changes beyond the given dataset information as not all EPDs will contain Density values.

properties.name: Density
properties.description: The material density in kg/m^3.

descriptionParts: A data fragment used to store irregular scaling values for EPDs.
Note this fragment is typically reserved for special circumstances requiring user override of documented EPD information.
Use AddFragment() to combine this information with any EPD for continuous integration.

properties.name: Dimension
properties.description: The standard dimension for the EPD being used for LCA calculations.

properties.name: SpecifiedDimension
properties.description: A user-provided scaling dimension that is derived from an EPD.

descriptionParts: A data fragment containing other optional information regarding the production and documentation of any Environmental Product Declaration.
Use AddFragment() to combine this information with any EPD for continuous integration.

properties.name: Description
properties.description: Brief summary of the EPD from the data source.

properties.name: EndOfLifeTreatment
properties.description: Description of the material's treatment after its useful life.

properties.name: Id
properties.description: Unique identifier of the EPD from the source of the information.

properties.name: IndustryStandards
properties.description: Industry Standards referenced in creating the product.

properties.name: Jurisdiction
properties.description: Jurisdiction within which the sector based product EPD originates.

properties.name: LifeSpan
properties.description: The period of useful life of the product measured in years.

properties.name: Manufacturer
properties.description: Manufacturer name responsible for the product being documented.

properties.name: PlantName
properties.description: Manufacturing facility name within which the product was created.

properties.name: PostalCode
properties.description: Postal Code within which the product was created.

properties.name: Publisher
properties.description: Publisher responsible for recording and presenting all EPD information.

properties.name: ReferenceYear
properties.description: Year in which the EPD was created. Default set to the current year, please override if creating an EPD from legacy information.

properties.description: This area takes the element's thickness into account to determine the actual area of the 'solid' portion of the ShapeProfile.

properties.name: ElementVoidArea
properties.description: The interior area within the element's shapeProfile. This corresponds to the actual open area less any material thickness.

descriptionParts: Air Handling Units are devices which house fans, filter, coils, and energy wheels which produce heated and cooled fresh/partially recirculated air to a building

properties.name: Type
properties.description: Type denotes the kind of Air Handling Unit (eg heat and ventilation, energy recovery)

properties.name: TotalAirFlow
properties.description: Total Airflow accounts for the maximum amount of supply/outside air that the Air Handling Unit will be passing. This value is measured in m3/s (e.g. 2.35 m3/s (5000 CFM) of Outside Air)

properties.name: AirVelocityAcrossCoil
properties.description: Air velocity across coil denotes the maximum velocity of the air that should be passed along the Air Handling Unit's coil. This value is measured in m/s (maximum values around 2.5 m/s (500 ft/min) are considered best practice)

properties.name: Parts
properties.description: A collection of the parts (Air Handling Unit, Fans, Coils, Energy Wheel, Filters, Electrical Connectors) that make up the Air Handling Unit

descriptionParts: Air Handling Units are devices which house fans, filter, coils, and energy wheels which produce heated and cooled fresh/partially recirculated air to a building

properties.name: TotalSupplyAirFlow
properties.description: Total Supply Airflow accounts for the total amount of air supplied to the building by the Air Handling Unit

properties.name: TotalSupplyAirExternalStaticPressure
properties.description: Total supply external static pressure denotes the resistance within the system that the supply fan has to overcome from filters, grilles, coils, etc

properties.name: TotalReturnAirFlow
properties.description: Total Return Airflow accounts for the total amount of air returned from the building to the Air Handling Unit

properties.name: TotalReturnAirExternalStaticPressure
properties.description: Total return external static pressure denotes the resistance within the system that the return fan has to overcome from grilles, ducts, etc

properties.name: TotalDesignOutdoorAirFlow
properties.description: Total Design Outdoor Airflow accounts for the total amount of outdoor air introduced to the supply air that goes to the building from the Air Handling Unit

properties.name: DemandControlledVentilationMinimumOutdoorAirFlow
properties.description: Demand Controlled Ventilation Minimum Outdoor Airflow denotes that amount of outdoor air that is required to be supplied to the building, at a minimum

properties.name: TotalOutdoorAirFlowExternalStaticPressure
properties.description: Total outdoor air external static pressure denotes the resistance within the system that the outdoor air intake fan has to overcome

properties.name: TotalReliefAirFlow
properties.description: Total Relief Airflow accounts for the total amount of extract/exhaust air that is removed from the system and introduced to the atmosphere

properties.name: TotalReliefExternalStaticPressure
properties.description: Total Relief Airflow external static pressure denotes the resistance within the system that the relief/extract/exhaust fan has to overcome

properties.name: SupplyAirEconomiser
properties.description: Supply Air Economisers allow additional outdoor air to be introduced to the system when outdoor conditions are favorable (typically cool and dry)

properties.name: WaterEconomiser
properties.description: Water Economisers allow returned fluids to be introduced to the system when conditions are favorable

properties.name: LeavingWetBulbAirTemperature
properties.description: Leaving Wet Bulb Air Temperature indicates the heat intensity of the air leaving the system in degrees Celsius, while taking humidity into consideration

descriptionParts: A type of damper used in ductwork (volume damper, fire smoke damper, etc.)
Enum values:
-Undefined
-BackdraftDamper
-BalancingDamper
-FireDamper
-FireSmokeDamper
-VolumeDamper
A type of fitting used to transition from one segment of linear MEP object to another.
Enum values:
-Undefined
-Adapter: A fitting that allows you to change the size/shape of the linear MEP segment at a given juncture.
-Cap: A fitting that is placed at the end of a linear MEP segment.
-Coupling: A fitting that joins two linear MEP segments of the same size and shape.
-Cross: A fitting that physically connects four different linear MEP segments, each at 90-degree angles.
-Elbow: A fitting that physically connects two different linear MEP segments, and re-directs the segment at a 30,45,60 or 90-degree angle.
-Olet: A fitting that allows you to change the size of the linear MEP segment at a given juncture, and gives additional reinforcement to both segments.
-Plug: A fitting that is placed at the end of a linear MEP segment, allowing future access for maintenance purposes (clean out).
-Reducer: A fitting that allows you to change the size of the linear MEP segment at a given juncture.
-Tap: A fitting that keeps the main linear MEP segment size the same and allows a 45-degree transition to a 90-degree branch.
-Transition: A fitting that allows you to change size and/or shape along the main linear MEP segment .
-Tee: A fitting that keeps the main linear MEP segment size the same and allows a branch at a 90-degree angle.
-Union: A fitting that joins two linear MEP segments of the same size and shape, of which each end can be unscrewed independently.
-Wye: A fitting that joins three linear MEP segments of differing sizes and shapes, also known as pants.

properties.name: DeckProfileName
properties.description: Deck profile name as per RAM

properties.name: Label
properties.description: Represents Grid System label as per RAM

properties.name: Type
properties.description: Represents Grid System type as per RAM

properties.name: XOffset
properties.description: Represents Grid System X offset

properties.name: YOffset
properties.description: Represents Grid System Y offset

properties.name: Rotation
properties.description: Represents Grid System rotation

properties.name: Axial
properties.description: Member Force axial at node per RAM

properties.name: Location
properties.description: Node distance location along member per RAM

properties.name: MomMaj
properties.description: Member Force moment maximum at node per RAM

properties.name: MomMin
properties.description: Member Force moment minimum at node per RAM

properties.name: ShearMaj
properties.description: Member Force shear maximum at node per RAM

properties.name: ShearMin
properties.description: Member Force shear minimum at node per RAM

properties.name: Torsion
properties.description: Member Force Torsion at node per RAM

properties.name: LoadcaseID
properties.description: Represents Loadcase ID as per RAM

properties.name: Material
properties.description: Represents Frame Material as per RAM

properties.name: FrameType
properties.description: Represents Frame Type as per RAM

properties.name: FloorType
properties.description: Represents Floor Type element is placed on as per RAM

properties.name: FrameNumber
properties.description: Represents Frame Number per RAM

properties.name: IsStubCantilever
properties.description: Represents if the element is a stub cantilever in RAM

properties.name: StartCantilever
properties.description: Represents the start cantilever distance (if applicable) in RAM

properties.name: EndCantilever
properties.description: Represents the end cantilever distance (if applicable) in RAM

properties.name: IsHangingColumn
properties.description: Represents if the element is a hanging column in RAM

properties.name: Studs
properties.description: Number of studs applied to frame

properties.name: Camber
properties.description: Camber length applied to frame

properties.name: DesignCapacityInteraction
properties.description: Design Capacity Interaction as per RAM

properties.name: CriticalDeflectionInteraction
properties.description: Critical Deflection Interaction as per RAM

properties.name: Id
properties.description: lUID of the element as assigned in RAM.

properties.name: FloorType
properties.description: The RAM FloorType that the element belongs to.

descriptionParts: Enum values:
-LiveReducibleLCa
-LiveStorageLCa
-LiveUnReducibleLCa
-LiveRoofLCa

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

properties.name: StartReaction
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Structure.Results.NodeReaction:  Resulting reaction forces and moments for a Node.

properties.name: EndReaction
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Structure.Results.NodeReaction:  Resulting reaction forces and moments for a Node.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: Configuration used to specify which geometry should be pulled and passed to RevitGeometry fragment.

properties.name: PullEdges
properties.description: If true, edges of elements will be pulled and stored under Revit_edges in RevitGeometry fragment.

properties.name: PullSurfaces
properties.description: If true, surfaces of elements will be pulled and stored under Revit_surfaces in RevitGeometry fragment.

properties.name: PullMeshes
properties.description: If true, meshed surfaces of elements will be pulled and stored under Revit_meshes in RevitGeometry fragment.

properties.name: MeshDetailLevel
properties.description: Detail level of mesh to be pulled, correspondent to level of detail in Revit.

properties.name: IncludeNonVisible
properties.description: Invisible element parts will be pulled and passed to RevitGeometry fragment if true. PullEdges or PullSurfaces switched to true needed for this to activate.

descriptionParts: Configuration used to specify representation to be pulled and passed to RevitRepresentation fragment.

properties.name: PullRenderMesh
properties.description: If true, representation of elements will be pulled and stored under RenderMesh in RevitRepresentation fragment.

properties.name: DetailLevel
properties.description: Detail level of representation, correspondent to level of detail in Revit.

properties.name: IncludeNonVisible
properties.description: Invisible element parts will be pulled and passed to RevitRepresentation fragment if true. PullRepresentation switched to true needed for this to activate.

descriptionParts: Configuration used for adapter interaction with Revit on Remove action.

properties.name: SuppressFailureMessages
properties.description: If true, Revit warnings and failure messages will be suppressed (not shown to the user). Whilst this option may speed the pushing process up in case of multiple warnings, it may lead to important issues.

properties.name: IncludeClosedWorksets
properties.description: Elements from closed worksets will be processed if true.

properties.name: RemovePinned
properties.description: Pinned elements will be processed if true.

properties.name: WrapNonBHoMObjects
properties.description: If true, the Push action wraps any non-BHoM type into a BH.oM.Adapter.ObjectWrapper, allowing them to make use of the full Adapter workflow.

properties.name: AllowHashForComparing
properties.description: If true and if no specific EqualityComparer is found for the type, Diffing hashes are computed and used to compare the objects.

properties.name: DiffingConfig
properties.description: Configurations for the Diffing hashing. Requires `AllowHashForComparing` to be set to true.  This is a BH.oM.Diffing.DiffingConfig:  General configurations for the Diffing process, including settings for the Hash computation.

descriptionParts: An object representing a cloned Revit type, to be pushed in order to create a new type.

properties.name: SourceTypeId
properties.description: ElementId of the source Revit type to be cloned.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: Fragment containing the geometry extracted from Revit element represented by the BHoM object.

properties.name: Edges
properties.description: Edge curves of Revit element represented by the BHoM object carrying this fragment.

properties.name: Surfaces
properties.description: Surface geometry of Revit element represented by the BHoM object carrying this fragment.

properties.name: Meshes
properties.description: Meshed surfaces of Revit element represented by the BHoM object carrying this fragment.

descriptionParts: A fragment containing the information about material take off extracted on a Revit element on Pull.

properties.name: TotalVolume
properties.description: Total volume of a Revit element correspondent to the BHoM object carrying this fragment.

properties.name: MaterialComposition
properties.description: Material composition of a Revit element correspondent to the BHoM object carrying this fragment.  This is a BH.oM.Physical.Materials.MaterialComposition:  Defines the make up of an object through a list of Materials as relative proportions of the total solid volume. There must be the same number of items in both lists, assigning a single Ratio for each Material.

descriptionParts: Fragment containing the representation extracted from Revit element represented by the BHoM object.

properties.name: RenderMeshes
properties.description: Mesh representation of Revit element represented by the BHoM object carrying this fragment.

descriptionParts: Library of Revit families that can be loaded to the model.

properties.name: Files
properties.description: A list of Revit family files managed by the library.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: Configuration used for adapter interaction with Revit on Push action.

properties.name: SuppressFailureMessages
properties.description: If true, Revit warnings and failure messages will be suppressed (not shown to the user). Whilst this option may speed the pushing process up in case of multiple warnings, it may lead to important issues.

properties.name: IncludeClosedWorksets
properties.description: Elements from closed worksets will be processed if true.

properties.name: SetLocationOnUpdate
properties.description: If false, only parameters of a Revit element will be updated.

properties.name: WrapNonBHoMObjects
properties.description: If true, the Push action wraps any non-BHoM type into a BH.oM.Adapter.ObjectWrapper, allowing them to make use of the full Adapter workflow.

properties.name: AllowHashForComparing
properties.description: If true and if no specific EqualityComparer is found for the type, Diffing hashes are computed and used to compare the objects.

properties.name: DiffingConfig
properties.description: Configurations for the Diffing hashing. Requires `AllowHashForComparing` to be set to true.  This is a BH.oM.Diffing.DiffingConfig:  General configurations for the Diffing process, including settings for the Hash computation.

descriptionParts: Configuration used for adapter interaction with Revit on Pull action.

properties.name: Discipline
properties.description: Discipline used on pull action. Default is Physical.

properties.name: IncludeClosedWorksets
properties.description: Elements from closed worksets will be processed if true.

properties.name: IncludeNestedElements
properties.description: Elements nested within families will be processed if true.

properties.name: GeometryConfig
properties.description: Configuration specifying which geometry should be pulled and passed to RevitGeometry fragment.  This is a BH.oM.Adapters.Revit.PullGeometryConfig:  Configuration used to specify which geometry should be pulled and passed to RevitGeometry fragment.

properties.name: RepresentationConfig
properties.description: Configuration specifying representation to be pulled and passed to RevitRepresentation fragment.  This is a BH.oM.Adapters.Revit.PullRepresentationConfig:  Configuration used to specify representation to be pulled and passed to RevitRepresentation fragment.

properties.name: PullMaterialTakeOff
properties.description: Material take offs of each pulled element will be attached to resultant BHoMObjects as fragments if true.

properties.name: WrapNonBHoMObjects
properties.description: If true, the Push action wraps any non-BHoM type into a BH.oM.Adapter.ObjectWrapper, allowing them to make use of the full Adapter workflow.

properties.name: AllowHashForComparing
properties.description: If true and if no specific EqualityComparer is found for the type, Diffing hashes are computed and used to compare the objects.

properties.name: DiffingConfig
properties.description: Configurations for the Diffing hashing. Requires `AllowHashForComparing` to be set to true.  This is a BH.oM.Diffing.DiffingConfig:  General configurations for the Diffing process, including settings for the Hash computation.

descriptionParts: Wrapper for Revit family file (.rfa) that stores basic information about it such as family category, familiy type names etc.

properties.name: Path
properties.description: Path to the Revit family file wrapped by this object.

properties.name: CategoryName
properties.description: Name of the Revit category, to which belongs the family wrapped by this object.

properties.name: FamilyName
properties.description: Name of the Revit family wrapped by this object.

properties.name: FamilyTypeNames
properties.description: Names of the family types contained within the Revit family wrapped by this object.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: Revit family load settings for Revit Adapter. Prototype, currently with limited functionality.

properties.name: FamilyLibrary
properties.description: Library of Revit families that can be loaded to the model.  This is a BH.oM.Adapters.Revit.FamilyLibrary:  Library of Revit families that can be loaded to the model.

properties.name: OverwriteFamily
properties.description: If true, Revit family will be overwritten on load, if false it will not be changed.

descriptionParts: Socket connection settings for Revit Adapter.

properties.name: PushPort
properties.description: Socket push port - this value needs to be equal to push port set in Revit Listener located in Add-Ins tab of Revit ribbon.

properties.name: PullPort
properties.description: Socket pull port - this value needs to be equal to pull port set in Revit Listener located in Add-Ins tab of Revit ribbon.

properties.name: MaxMinutesToWait
properties.description: Maximum number of minutes per adapter action, after which the adapter will automatically stop exchanging data with Revit. Increase this number if push/pull action is expected to take longer.

properties.name: TagsParameter
properties.description: Name of the Revit parameter to be used as a source (on Pull) and target (on Push) of information for BHoM tags.

properties.name: MaterialGradeParameter
properties.description: Name of the Revit parameter to be used as a source of information about material grade of a Revit element.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters all elements from a Revit link with given file name/path, Name parameter value or ElementId.

properties.name: LinkName
properties.description: Name of the link file (alternatively whole file path, Name parameter value or ElementId) to pull from, case insensitive.

properties.name: CaseSensitive
properties.description: If true: only perfect, case sensitive text match will be accepted. If false: capitals and small letters will be treated as equal.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters all Revit elements that intersect or are contained in a Scope Box with the given name.
In case of combining this request with FilterByLink, the Scope Box will be sought for in both link document as well as the host document.

properties.name: BoxName
properties.description: Name of the Revit Scope Box to be used as a geometrical filter.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters all elements and types in the Revit model. This means a lot of data - please use carefully!

IRequest that filters all link instances with given file name/path, Name parameter value or ElementId from active Revit document. If link name field is left blank, all link instances in the document will be filtered.

properties.name: LinkName
properties.description: Name of the link file (alternatively whole file path, Name parameter value or ElementId) used to filter the Revit link instances. Optional: if left blank, all link instances in the document will be filtered.

properties.name: CaseSensitive
properties.description: If true: only perfect, case sensitive text match will be accepted. If false: capitals and small letters will be treated as equal.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters all elements that are contained in an energy analysis model.
IRequest that filters the active view in Revit.
IRequest that filters all elements in active Revit workset.
IRequest that filters all elements of a Revit category.

properties.name: CategoryName
properties.description: Revit category name, as shown in Revit user interface (currently only English supported).

properties.name: CaseSensitive
properties.description: If true: only perfect, case sensitive text match will be accepted. If false: capitals and small letters will be treated as equal.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters all elements of given Autodesk.Revit.DB type. Information about types can be found in the Revit API documentation.

properties.name: TypeName
properties.description: Full Revit DB type name, including namespace before the name of the actual type. For example: 'Autodesk.Revit.DB.Wall.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters elements by their ElementIds.

properties.name: ElementIds
properties.description: List of integers representing Revit ElementIds to be used to filter the elements.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters all elements of given Revit family and type, with option to loose the search by leaving one of the input names blank.

properties.name: FamilyName
properties.description: Name of Revit family as shown in Revit UI. Optional: if left blank, all families will be filtered in search for specified family type name.

properties.name: FamilyTypeName
properties.description: Revit family type name matching one displayed in Revit UI. Optional: if left blank, elements of all types within family will be returned.

properties.name: CaseSensitive
properties.description: If true: only perfect, case sensitive text match will be accepted. If false: capitals and small letters will be treated as equal.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters all elements of given Revit family type.

properties.name: FamilyTypeId
properties.description: ElementId of the Revit family type.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters elements based on given Boolean parameter value criterion.

properties.name: ParameterName
properties.description: Case sensitive name of the parameter to be used as filter criterion.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: Value to compare the parameter against.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters elements based on given ElementId parameter value criterion.

properties.name: ParameterName
properties.description: Case sensitive name of the parameter to be used as filter criterion.

properties.name: ElementId
properties.description: Value to compare the parameter against.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters elements the have (or do not have) a parameter with given name.

properties.name: ParameterName
properties.description: Case sensitive name of the parameter to look for.

properties.name: ParameterExists
properties.description: If true, elements with the given parameter will be filtered, if false - the opposite.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters elements based on given integer parameter value criterion.

properties.name: ParameterName
properties.description: Case sensitive name of the parameter to be used as filter criterion.

properties.name: NumberComparisonType
properties.description: NumberComparisonType enum representing comparison type, e.g. equality, greater, smaller etc.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: Value to compare the parameter against.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters elements based on given floating point number parameter value criterion.

properties.name: ParameterName
properties.description: Case sensitive name of the parameter to be used as filter criterion.

properties.name: NumberComparisonType
properties.description: NumberComparisonType enum representing comparison type, e.g. equality, greater, smaller etc.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: Value to compare the parameter against.

properties.name: Tolerance
properties.description: Numerical tolerance for number comparison.

properties.name: ConvertUnits
properties.description: If true, the Revit values are converted to SI prior to being compared against the specified value, otherwise not.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters elements based on given text parameter value criterion.

properties.name: ParameterName
properties.description: Case sensitive name of the parameter to be used as filter criterion.

properties.name: TextComparisonType
properties.description: TextComparisonType enum representing comparison type, e.g. equality, contains, starts with etc.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: Value to compare the parameter against.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters elements contained in a given Revit Selection Set.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters elements by their UniqueIds.

properties.description: List of Revit UniqueIds to be used to filter the elements.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters used/unused elements in a Revit document.

properties.description: Value that specifies whether used or unused elements are meant to be filtered out.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters elements specific to (owned by) a given view in Revit.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters all elements visible in a given Revit view.

descriptionParts: IRequest that filters all elements in a given Revit workset.

properties.name: CaseSensitive
properties.description: If true: only perfect, case sensitive text match will be accepted. If false: capitals and small letters will be treated as equal.

descriptionParts: An object representing the definition of a Revit parameter (project parameter or shared parameter as such, not its value related to certain element or type).

properties.name: ParameterGroup
properties.description: Parameter group, to which the Revit parameter represented by this object belongs. One of the dropdown values for project parameters, any value for shared parameter.

properties.name: ParameterType
properties.description: Parameter type of the Revit parameter represented by this object.

properties.name: Discipline
properties.description: Discipline, to which the Revit parameter represented by this object belongs. Only relevant in case if there is more than one types with the same name (e.g. piping, HVAC and structural Velocity). Six sensible values can be applied: Common, Electrical, Energy, HVAC, Piping and Structural.

properties.name: Instance
properties.description: If true, the Revit parameter represented by this object is an instance parameter, otherwise it is a type parameter.

properties.name: Categories
properties.description: Categories, to which the Revit parameter represented by this object is bound. On Push, it will get bound to all categories if this value is null.

properties.name: Shared
properties.description: If true, the Revit parameter represented by this object is a shared parameter, otherwise it is a project parameter.

descriptionParts: An entity containing identifiers of Revit element correspondent to the BHoM object that carries it.

properties.name: PersistentId
properties.description: The PersistentId property stores the UniqueId of the Revit element correspondent to the BHoM object that owns this fragment. The PersistentId can be used for Diffing purposes.

properties.name: ElementId
properties.description: ElementId of the Revit element correspondent to the BHoM object that carries this fragment.

properties.name: CategoryName
properties.description: Category of the Revit element correspondent to the BHoM object that carries this fragment.

properties.name: FamilyName
properties.description: Family of the Revit element correspondent to the BHoM object that carries this fragment.

properties.name: FamilyTypeName
properties.description: Family type of the Revit element correspondent to the BHoM object that carries this fragment.

properties.name: FamilyTypeId
properties.description: ElementId of family type of the Revit element correspondent to the BHoM object that carries this fragment.

properties.name: Workset
properties.description: Name of the parent workset of the Revit element correspondent to the BHoM object that carries this fragment. Empty if the Revit model is not shared.

properties.name: HostId
properties.description: ElementId of the host element of the Revit element correspondent to the BHoM object that carries this fragment. -1 if the Revit element is not a hosted element.

properties.name: OwnerViewId
properties.description: ElementId of view that owns the Revit element correspondent to the BHoM object that carries this fragment. -1 if the Revit element is not view-dependent.

properties.name: ParentElementId
properties.description: ElementId of the parent element of the Revit element correspondent to the BHoM object that carries this fragment. -1 if the Revit element is not a nested element.

properties.name: LinkPath
properties.description: Path to the link document containing the Revit element correspondent to the BHoM object that carries this fragment. Empty if the Revit element is not a link element.

descriptionParts: Enum specifying detail level of representation, correspondent to level of detail in Revit.
Enum values:
-Coarse: Coarse - correspondent to Revit level of detail with same name.
-Medium: Medium - correspondent to Revit level of detail with same name.
-Fine: Fine - correspondent to Revit level of detail with same name.
Enumerator allowing choosing to which discipline (and corresponding namespace) should Revit elements be converted on pull.
Enum values:
-Undefined: Default discipline to be used.
-Environmental: Elements to be converted to types from BH.oM.Environment. If no suitable conversion exists, default discipline to be used.
-Structural: Elements to be converted to types from BH.oM.Structure. If no suitable conversion exists, default discipline to be used.
-Architecture: Elements to be converted to types from BH.oM.Architecture. If no suitable conversion exists, default discipline to be used.
-Physical: Elements to be converted to types from BH.oM.Physical. If no suitable conversion exists, default discipline to be used.
-Facade: Elements to be converted to types from BH.oM.Facade. If no suitable conversion exists, default discipline to be used.
Enumerator defining the way in which two numbers are compared.
Enum values:
-Equal: Check if input number and reference number are equal.
-NotEqual: Check if input number and reference number are not equal.
-Greater: Check if input number is greater than reference number.
-Less: Check if input number is smaller than reference number.
-LessOrEqual: Check if input number is smaller than or equal to reference number.
-GreaterOrEqual: Check if input number is greater than or equal to reference number.
Enumerator defining view type of Revit view. A clone of Autodesk.Revit.DB.ViewType enum.
Enum values:
-Undefined: Undefined/unspecified type of view.
-FloorPlan: Floor plan type of view.
-CeilingPlan: Reflected ceiling plan type of view.
-Elevation: Elevation type of view.
-ThreeD: 3-D type of view.
-Schedule: Schedule type of view.
-DrawingSheet: Drawing sheet type of view.
-ProjectBrowser: The project browser view.
-Report: Report type of view.
-DraftingView: Drafting type of view.
-Legend: Legend type of view.
-SystemBrowser: The MEP system browser view.
-EngineeringPlan: Structural plan or Engineering plan type of view.
-AreaPlan: Area plan type of view.
-Section: Cross section type of view.
-Detail: Detail type of view.
-CostReport: Cost Report view.
-LoadsReport: Loads Report view.
-PresureLossReport: Pressure Loss Report view.
-...And more
Enumerator defining the way in which two strings are compared.
Enum values:
-Equal: Check if input string and reference string are the same.
-NotEqual: Check if input string and reference string are different.
-Contains: Check if the input input string contains reference string.
-ContainsNot: Check if the input input string does not contain reference string.
-StartsWith: Check if the input input string starts with reference string.
-EndsWith: Check if the input input string ends with reference string.
A generic wrapper BHoM type corresponding to any view-specific Revit element (drafting elements e.g. lines and hatches, tags, text notes etc.).

properties.name: Properties
properties.description: Information about Revit family type or graphic type of the instance.  This is a BH.oM.Adapters.Revit.Properties.InstanceProperties:  A generic wrapper BHoM type corresponding to any Revit family type. Name of InstanceProperties corresponds to family type name, type parameter values are stored in RevitParametersToPush.

properties.name: Location
properties.description: Location of the instance in three dimensional space.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.IGeometry:  The parent interface for all primative geometrical objects. IGeometry implements IObject - and not IBHoMObject. Equally primative geometrical objects do not inherit from the base BHoMObject class either. As primatives, the additional base BHoM properties are omitted for both efficency and performace.  This can be of the following types: Arc, Circle, Ellipse, Line, NurbsCurve, PolyCurve, Polyline, Face, CellRelation, Mesh3D, Mesh, BoundingBox, CompositeGeometry, Quaternion, SurfaceTrim, and more...

properties.name: Orientation
properties.description: Orientation of the instance in 2 dimensional space (only X and Y vectors are relevant). Applicable only to point-based DraftingInstances. If null, a default orientation will be applied.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Basis:  An ordered set of mutually orthogonal unit vectors defining three-dimensional orientation in space

properties.name: ViewName
properties.description: Name of Revit view to which the instance belongs.

descriptionParts: This Config can be specified in the `ActionConfig` input of any Adapter Action (e.g. Push).

properties.name: ReplaceLoads
properties.description: Sets whether the loads being pushed should overwrite existing loads on the same object within the same loadcase

properties.name: UpdateOnlyBarPropAssigns
properties.description: If true, only Bar property assignments will be updated, ignoring changes to property definitions, geometry or other Bar assigns such as offsets, releases, etc. Non-existing objects will still be pushed.

properties.name: WrapNonBHoMObjects
properties.description: If true, the Push action wraps any non-BHoM type into a BH.oM.Adapter.ObjectWrapper, allowing them to make use of the full Adapter workflow.

properties.name: AllowHashForComparing
properties.description: If true and if no specific EqualityComparer is found for the type, Diffing hashes are computed and used to compare the objects.

properties.name: DiffingConfig
properties.description: Configurations for the Diffing hashing. Requires `AllowHashForComparing` to be set to true.  This is a BH.oM.Diffing.DiffingConfig:  General configurations for the Diffing process, including settings for the Hash computation.

properties.name: Id
properties.description: Id or multi-ids of the element as assigned in SAP2000

properties.name: PersistentId
properties.description: Persistent GUID assigned by SAP2000 upon element creation. This does not vary when the element is modified. Only populated for Element-type objects

descriptionParts: Enum values:
-ShellThin
-ShellThick
-PlateThin
-PlateThick
-Membrane
-ShellLayeredNL

properties.name: Code
properties.description: Defines which code to get steel utilization design results for.

properties.name: Cases
properties.description: Defines which cases and/or combinations that results should be extracted for. Can generally be set to either Loadcase or Loadcombination objects, or identifiers matching the software. If nothing is provided, results for all cases will be assumed.

properties.name: Modes
properties.description: Defines for which modes results should be extracted. Only applicable for some casetypes. If nothing is provided, results for all modes will be assumed.

properties.name: ObjectIds
properties.description: Defines which bars that results should be extracted for. Can generally be set to either pulled bar objects, or identifiers matching the software. If nothing is provided, results for all bars will be assumed.

properties.name: InsertionPoint
properties.description: Bar insertion point based on cross section.

properties.name: ModifyStiffness
properties.description: Transform frame stiffness for offsets from centroid.

properties.name: DesignProcedure
properties.description: Design procedure based on material type.

properties.name: AutoMesh
properties.description: True if the frame object is to be automatically meshed by the program when the SAP analysis model is created.

properties.name: AutoMeshAtPoints
properties.description: If AutoMesh is True, the frame object is automatically meshed at intermediate joints along its length.

properties.name: AutoMeshAtLines
properties.description: If AutoMesh is True, the frame object is automatically meshed at intersections with other frames, area object edges, and solid object edges.

properties.name: NumSegs
properties.description: If AutoMesh is True, the minimum number of elements into which the frame object is automatically meshed. If zero, the number of elements is not checked when the automatic meshing is done.

properties.name: AutoMeshMaxLength
properties.description: If AutoMesh is True, the maximum length of auto meshed frame elements. If zero, the element length is not checked when automatic meshing is done.

descriptionParts: Base class for all bar result classes. Stores all identifier information and how to sort the results in a collection.

properties.name: ObjectId
properties.description: Id of the bar that this result belongs to. When extracted from an analysis package, the object id will match the format and value used in that particular package.

properties.name: ResultCase
properties.description: Identifier for the Loadcase or LoadCombination that the result belongs to. Is generally name or number of the loadcase, depending on the analysis package.

properties.name: ModeNumber
properties.description: Positive index, starting at one. Only set for cases with modal outputs such as dynamic cases.

properties.name: TimeStep
properties.description: Time step for time history results.

properties.name: Position
properties.description: Position on the bar as normalised length, i.e. 0 for start, 1 for end and 0.5 for middle.

properties.name: Divisions
properties.description: How many division points along the bar was used when extracting this result. This generally means that this many results with the same ObjectId, ResultCase and TimeStep was extracted.

A camera object is a electronic security device typically used in closed-circuit television (CCTV) systems.

properties.name: EyePosition
properties.description: The point at which the Camera is installed, known as the eye position.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Point:  Defines a dimensionless location in three-dimensional space.

properties.name: TargetPosition
properties.description: The point at which the Camera is looking at, known as the target position.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Point:  Defines a dimensionless location in three-dimensional space.

properties.name: HorizontalFieldOfView
properties.description: The horizontal field of view of the Camera, known as the real-world width length of what the camera views.

properties.name: Mounting
properties.description: The Camera mounting type that describes how it's installed.

properties.name: Type
properties.description: The Camera type that describes its characteristics.

properties.name: Megapixels
properties.description: The Camera megapixels that determines its image quality.

descriptionParts: Linear distribution of points along a vector from one side of the perimeter of the host object to the other.

properties.description: Offset of the linear layout in relation to the reference point, perpendicular to the Direction vector in the XY plane. A positive value will mean an offset towards the centre of the boundingbox of the host objects.

properties.name: ReferencePoint
properties.description: Controls which point on the host element that should be used for the layout.

This object can be used to group geometry to push to a specific file. Useful if pushing groups of geometry related to specific representations, for example, a group of panels to one file, and a group of bars to another.

properties.name: FileName
properties.description: The name of the file which this geometry should be stored (pushed) to. Do not include a directory on this file name, the save directory should be specified on the STLSettings object for the Adapter. Do not provide a file extension either, this will be handled by the Adapter.

Property for 2D analytical elements, made up of a slab on top of parallel ribs running in one direction, all sharing the same material.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: A unique Name is required for some structural packages to create and identify the object.

properties.name: Thickness
properties.description: The thickness of the slab sitting on top of the ribs.

properties.name: Material
properties.description: Homogenous structural material throughout the full thickness of the element.  This is a BH.oM.Structure.MaterialFragments.IMaterialFragment:  Base interface for structural materials used by structural properties or as a fragment of the physical material.  This can be of the following types: Fabric, Aluminium, Concrete, GenericIsotropicMaterial, GenericOrthotropicMaterial, Steel, Timber

properties.name: Direction
properties.description: Specifies if the ribs are running in local x or y direction.

properties.name: TotalDepth
properties.description: Total depth measured from the bottom of the ribs to the top of the slab.

properties.name: StemWidth
properties.description: Width of each rib.

properties.name: Spacing
properties.description: Centre-centre distance between the ribs. Measured perpendicular to the rib direction.

properties.name: PanelType
properties.description: Defines what type of element this property will be used. Used by some analysis packages.

properties.description: Defines the distance the element should be extruded along its normal. By default the element will be extruded half the thickness 'upwards' and half the thickness 'downwards' meaning the element base geoemtry will be in the centre of the extrusion.

This can be of the following types: Fabric, Aluminium, Concrete, GenericIsotropicMaterial, GenericOrthotropicMaterial, Steel, Timber

This is a BH.oM.Structure.MaterialFragments.IMaterialFragment:  Base interface for structural materials used by structural properties or as a fragment of the physical material. descriptionParts: Defines the  reinforcement of a Panel in the longitudinal and transverse direction specified by the Basis of the ReinforcementRegion.
If the diameter of the reinforcement is set to 0, it will be assumed that no reinforcement is present in this direction.

properties.name: Material
properties.description: Material of the reinforcement.  This is a BH.oM.Structure.MaterialFragments.IMaterialFragment:  Base interface for structural materials used by structural properties or as a fragment of the physical material.  This can be of the following types: Fabric, Aluminium, Concrete, GenericIsotropicMaterial, GenericOrthotropicMaterial, Steel, Timber

properties.name: Region
properties.description: The region defining the area of the Panel to be reinforced.  This is a BH.oM.Structure.Reinforcement.ReinforcementRegion:  A region defining the area of a Panel to be reinforced. The curve must exist within the 2D region outlined by ExternalEdges of the Panel.

properties.name: LongitudinalDiameter
properties.description: The diameter of the reinforcement in the longitudinal direction, denoted by the local x direction of the ReinforcementRegion. If the diameter is set 0, it will be assumed that no reinforcement is present in the longitudinal direction.

properties.name: LongitudinalSpacing
properties.description: The spacing of the reinforcement in the longitudinal direction, measured perpindicular to the local x direction of the ReinforcementRegion.

properties.name: LongitudinalDepth
properties.description: The depth of longitudinal reinforcement measured from the centre of Panel along the normal. This will be negative for bottom reinforcement.

properties.name: TransverseDiameter
properties.description: The diameter of the reinforcement in the transverse direction, denoted by the local y direction of the ReinforcementRegion. If the diameter is set 0, it will be assumed that no reinforcement is present in the longitudinal direction.

properties.name: TransverseSpacing
properties.description: The spacing of the reinforcement in the transverse direction, measured perpindicular to the local y direction of the ReinforcementRegion.

properties.name: TransverseDepth
properties.description: The depth of transverse reinforcement measured from the centre of Panel along the normal. This will be negative for bottom reinforcement.

properties.name: MinimumCover
properties.description: Minimum cover for the reinforcement defined in this PanelReinforcement.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: A collection of PanelReinforcement objects that represent the rebar intent.

properties.description: A collection of IBarReinforcement objects.

properties.name: MinimumCover
properties.description: Minimum reinforcement cover of the section.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: A region defining the area of a Panel to be reinforced. The curve must exist within the 2D region outlined by ExternalEdges of the Panel.

properties.name: Orientation
properties.description: Local x, y, and z axes of the region as a vector Basis. Defaults to OrientationAngle and Plane of Panel if null or empty.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Basis:  An ordered set of mutually orthogonal unit vectors defining three-dimensional orientation in space

properties.name: Perimeter
properties.description: A 2D curve defining the external boundaries of the region to be reinforced. The curve must exist within the ExternalEdges of the Panel. Defaultsto the Panel perimeter if null or empty.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.ICurve:  The interface for all one-dimensional geometrical objects.  This can be of the following types: Arc, Circle, Ellipse, Line, NurbsCurve, PolyCurve, Polyline

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

descriptionParts: Defines any transverse reinforcement along a Bar.

properties.name: CenterlineLayout
properties.description: Layout controlling the reinforcement shape in relation to the bar's section.  This is a BH.oM.Spatial.Layouts.ICurveLayout:  Base interface for all curve layouts.  This can be of the following types: ExplicitCurveLayout, OffsetCurveLayout

properties.name: Diameter
properties.description: Diameter of a single rebar.

properties.name: Material
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Structure.MaterialFragments.IMaterialFragment:  Base interface for structural materials used by structural properties or as a fragment of the physical material.  This can be of the following types: Fabric, Aluminium, Concrete, GenericIsotropicMaterial, GenericOrthotropicMaterial, Steel, Timber

properties.name: Spacing
properties.description: Axial distance between consecutive rebars. If AdjustSpacingToFit is true it will become maximum spacing.

properties.name: AdjustSpacingToFit
properties.description: Toggles if provided spacing value should be fixed or adjusted to fit rebars from the host bar's start to end.

properties.name: StartLocation
properties.description: Normalised length (0 means start, 1 means end) along the element where the rebars start.

properties.name: EndLocation
properties.description: Normalised length (0 means start, 1 means end) along the element where the rebars ends.

descriptionParts: Resulting total displacements in global coordinates along the bar.

properties.name: UX
properties.description: Total displacement along the global X-axis.

properties.name: UY
properties.description: Total displacement along the global Y-axis.

properties.name: UZ
properties.description: Total displacement along the global Z-axis.

properties.name: RX
properties.description: Total rotation about the global X-axis.

properties.name: RY
properties.description: Total rotation about the global Y-axis.

properties.name: RZ
properties.description: Total rotation about the global Z-axis.

properties.name: ObjectId
properties.description: Id of the bar that this result belongs to. When extracted from an analysis package, the object id will match the format and value used in that particular package.

properties.name: ResultCase
properties.description: Identifier for the Loadcase or LoadCombination that the result belongs to. Is generally name or number of the loadcase, depending on the analysis package.

properties.name: ModeNumber
properties.description: Positive index, starting at one. Only set for cases with modal outputs such as dynamic cases.

properties.name: TimeStep
properties.description: Time step for time history results.

properties.name: Position
properties.description: Position on the bar as normalised length, i.e. 0 for start, 1 for end and 0.5 for middle.

properties.name: Divisions
properties.description: How many division points along the bar was used when extracting this result. This generally means that this many results with the same ObjectId, ResultCase and TimeStep was extracted.

properties.description: Vector basis required in order to report results in a particular direction, for example, for anisotropic materials.  This is a BH.oM.Geometry.Basis:  An ordered set of mutually orthogonal unit vectors defining three-dimensional orientation in space

descriptionParts: Resulting local deformation of the Bar in local coordinates. This is disregarding rigid body motion and/or rotation of the Bar.

properties.name: UX
properties.description: Local deformation of the Bar along the local x-axis. Local axial deformation of the Bar.

properties.name: UY
properties.description: Local deformation of the Bar along the local y-axis. Generally minor axis deformation.

properties.name: UZ
properties.description: Local deformation of the Bar along the local z-axis. Generally major axis deformation.

properties.name: RX
properties.description: Localised rotation of the Bar about the local x-axis. Twist of the Bar.

properties.name: RY
properties.description: Localised rotation of the Bar about the local y-axis. Generally major axis rotation.

properties.name: RZ
properties.description: Localised rotation of the Bar about the local z-axis. Generally minor axis rotation.

properties.name: ObjectId
properties.description: Id of the bar that this result belongs to. When extracted from an analysis package, the object id will match the format and value used in that particular package.

properties.name: Divisions
properties.description: How many division points along the bar was used when extracting this result. This generally means that this many results with the same ObjectId, ResultCase and TimeStep was extracted.

descriptionParts: Resulting section forces in local coordinates along the bar.

properties.name: FX
properties.description: Axial force along the local x-axis. Positive for tension, negative for compression.

properties.name: FY
properties.description: Shear force along the local y-axis. Generally minor axis shear force.

properties.name: FZ
properties.description: Shear force along the local z-axis. Generally major axis shear force.

properties.name: MX
properties.description: Torsional moment.

properties.name: MY
properties.description: Bending moment about the local y-axis. Generally major axis bending moment.

properties.name: MZ
properties.description: Bending moment about the local z-axis. Generally minor axis bending moment.

descriptionParts: Resulting axial strain along the bar in local coordinates.

properties.name: Axial
properties.description: Axial strain induced by an axial force along the Bar axis. Positive for elongation, negative for contraction.

properties.name: ShearY
properties.description: Shear strain along the local y-axis. Generally minor axis shear strain.

properties.name: ShearZ
properties.description: Shear strain along the local z-axis. Generally major axis shear strain.

properties.name: BendingY_Top
properties.description: Strain induced by bending about the local y-axis at the 'uppermost' extreme fiber. Generally the major axis bending strains in one of the extreme fibers.

properties.name: BendingY_Bot
properties.description: Strain induced by bending about the local y-axis at the 'lowermost' extreme fiber. Generally the major axis bending strains in one of the extreme fibers.

properties.name: BendingZ_Top
properties.description: Strain induced by bending about the local z-axis at the 'uppermost' extreme fiber. Generally the minor axis bending strains in one of the extreme fibers.

properties.name: BendingZ_Bot
properties.description: Strain induced by bending about the local z-axis at the 'lowermost' extreme fiber. Generally the minor axis bending strains in one of the extreme fibers.

properties.name: CombAxialBendingPos
properties.description: Worst case elongation (axial strain) from combined axial and bending in two directions.

properties.name: CombAxialBendingNeg
properties.description: Worst case contraction (axial strain) from combined axial and bending in two directions.

descriptionParts: Resulting stresses in local coordinates along the bar.

properties.name: Axial
properties.description: Axial stress induced by an axial force along the Bar axis. Positive for tension, negative for compression.

properties.name: ShearY
properties.description: Shear stress along the local y-axis. Generally minor axis shear stress.

properties.name: ShearZ
properties.description: Shear stress along the local z-axis. Generally major axis shear stress.

properties.name: BendingY_Top
properties.description: Stress induced by bending about the local y-axis at the 'uppermost' extreme fiber. Generally the major axis bending stresses in one of the extreme fibers.

properties.name: BendingY_Bot
properties.description: Stress induced by bending about the local y-axis at the 'lowermost' extreme fiber. Generally the major axis bending stresses in one of the extreme fibers.

properties.name: BendingZ_Top
properties.description: Stress induced by bending about the local z-axis at the 'uppermost' extreme fiber. Generally the minor axis bending stresses in one of the extreme fibers.

properties.name: BendingZ_Bot
properties.description: Stress induced by bending about the local z-axis at the 'lowermost' extreme fiber. Generally the minor axis bending stresses in one of the extreme fibers.

properties.name: CombAxialBendingPos
properties.description: Worst case tensile normal stress from combined axial and bending in two directions.

properties.name: CombAxialBendingNeg
properties.description: Worst case compressive normal stress from combined axial and bending in two directions.

descriptionParts: Specifies which layer the results are extracted from or if it is a maxima/minima of the layers.
Enum values:
-Lower: Lower surface/extreme fibre of the panel/mesh element.
-Middle: Middle layer of the panel/mesh element.
-Upper: Upper surface/extreme fibre of the panel/mesh element.
-Minimum: The minimum value of all layers in the panel/mesh element.
-Maximum: The maximum value of all layers in the panel/mesh element.
-AbsoluteMaximum: The absolute maximum value of all layers in the panel/mesh element.
-Arbitrary: An arbitrary position within the thickness of the element.
Defines the smoothing used for the Meshresults, i.e. if and how any result averaging should be done per nodes/face.
Enum values:
-None
-ByPanel
-BySelection
-Global
-ByFiniteElementCentres
Specifies which layer the results are extracted from or if it is a maxima/minima of the layers.
Enum values:
-Forces: Bending moments and shear forces out-of-plane, membrane forces in the plane of the mesh/element.
-Stresses: Stresses in the plane of the mesh/element.
-Displacements: Displacements of the mesh/element nodes.
-VonMises: Von Mises stresses and forces.
-MeshModeShape: Mode shape of the mesh/element nodes.
Displacements and rotations at a discrete location in the Panel/FEMesh.

descriptionParts: Request for extracting Bar results from an adapter.

properties.name: DivisionType
properties.description: Defines which internal points results should be extracted for. For evenly distributed the bar is split into equal length segments, controlled by the divisions. For ExtremeValues the positions with extreme forces for any DOF will be included, which means you might get more/less values than stated in the Divisions.

properties.name: Divisions
properties.description: Defines how many points along the bar that results should be extracted for.

properties.name: Cases
properties.description: Defines which cases and/or combinations that results should be extracted for. Can generally be set to either Loadcase or Loadcombination objects, or identifiers matching the software. If nothing is provided, results for all cases will be assumed.

properties.name: Modes
properties.description: Defines for which modes results should be extracted. Only applicable for some casetypes. If nothing is provided, results for all modes will be assumed.

properties.name: ObjectIds
properties.description: Defines which Bars that results should be extracted for. Can generally be set to either pulled Bar objects, or identifiers matching the software. If nothing is provided, results for all Bars will be assumed.

descriptionParts: Enum values:
-Reactions
-ModalDynamics
Enum values:
-NodeReaction
-NodeDisplacement
-NodeVelocity
-NodeAcceleration
-NodeModalMass
-NodeModeShape
Defines the type of results that should be extracted for BarResultRequests.
Enum values:
-BarForce
-BarDeformation: Local deformation of the bar. All results given in local coordinates.
-BarStress
-BarStrain
-BarDisplacement: Total displacement of the bar. All results given in global coordinates.
-BarModeShape: Mode shape of the bar. All results given in global coordinates, normalised to 1.
Enum values:
-EvenlyDistributed
-ExtremeValues
Request for extracting global structural results from an adapter.

properties.name: ResultType
properties.description: Defines which type of results that should be extracted.

properties.name: Cases
properties.description: Defines which cases and/or combinations that results should be extracted for. Can generally be set to either Loadcase or Loadcombination objects, or identifiers matching the software. If nothing is provided, results for all cases will be assumed.

properties.name: Modes
properties.description: Defines for which modes results should be extracted. Only applicable for some casetypes. If nothing is provided, results for all modes will be assumed.

properties.name: ObjectIds
properties.description: Defines which objects that results should be extracted for. Not used for most global results.

descriptionParts: Structural aluminium material to be used on structural elements and properties or as a fragment of the physical material.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: Unique Names are required for some structural packages to create and identify the object.

properties.name: DampingRatio
properties.description: Dynamic damping ratio, expressed as a ratio between actual damping and critical damping. For structures, typically taken as 0.02 (i.e. 2%).

properties.name: PoissonsRatio
properties.description: Ratio between axial and transverse strain. Used together with YoungsModulus to derive the ShearModulus for isotropic materials.

properties.name: ThermalExpansionCoeff
properties.description: The strain induced in the material per unit change of temperature.

properties.name: YoungsModulus
properties.description: Modulus of elasticity of the material. Ratio between axial stress and axial strain.

properties.name: Fragments
properties.description: This is a BH.oM.Base.FragmentSet

properties.name: KNorm
properties.description: Defines the stiffness in Z- or Normal-direction. This will only be active when corresponding degree of freedom has a DOFType with a stiffness dependency, such as Spring.
